title: Excellent service and cool decor
text: Great experience at Graduate. Lovely customer service from the moment we arrived - offered us room options, place to store bags, could return to check in whenever we liked. Extra water bottles in rooms for free when we asked. The decor throughout the hotel is really cool and different. Beds comfy and shower pressure good! Staying on Roosevelt island was unique but fun and actually a good spot for getting into and around manhattan.

title: Quiet in the City
text: Our family of 3 stayed overnight in August 2022. The hotel is modern, clean, well-airconditioned, well-lit, and quiet. The adorable, enormous sculpture welcomes all to the lobby. Our room was spacious & squeaky clean with a wonderful bathroom (great toiletries) and sumptuous beds. The decor is so detailed and wonderful. If you have ever stayed in NYC, you know how loud it can be. This location is near transportation (subway and sky-liner) into Manhattan and Queens but feels remote and quiet. The views from the East River to the east side skyline are outstanding. They offered us early check in and the staff was so gracious and welcoming. Our tween loved the cool factor of the hotel. We will be back asap.

title: I know and I know
text:
We stayed at this hotel for the first few days of our honeymoon. Upon arrival they didn't want to accept the deposit in cash, they wanted to send us away (after hours of intercontinental flight), because our card probably didn't connect to the international circuit automatically and didn't work, which was also resolved the next morning.
Let's say that it wasn't an initial “Nyc is always a good idea”, but as the days went by it got better. Certainly far from the chaos of Manhattan, Roosevelt Island seems like an oasis of peace!

title: The best stay in NY
text: The best stay en ny, the rooms are very comfortable, the front desk and the people who attend the restaurant was great! Fully recommend!!! We enjoy a lot with my family! All the best in this hotel! The design and the decoration was great, the rooms always perfect!

title: Incredible hotel
text: The best views, food and staff! I’ve stayed several times and this hotel is my go-to place in NYC. Quiet peaceful respite in the heart of the city.  Beds are extremely comfortable. Treat yourself to a stay. Highly recommended

title: Unusual Hotel to stay in the heart of the Upper East Side
text:
Modern hotel at the tip of Roosevelt Island in the middle of the East River. Memorable views of the UN and other skyscrapers from the hotel. The room was excellent with a great view. Good breakfast. The only criticism was that you need to be sure whether your room comes with a complementary (fairly basic) breakfast.
The highlight however was using the Airtram to get from the Island to 'the mainland' - a brilliant way of traveling

title: Great location, staff manageable
text: OK, great location, difficult to book, no booking confirmation, bad call center, room uncleaned upon arrival, unusual when arriving at night, reception very passive. Various duplicate credit card bookings and cancellations in the higher 4-digit range

title: Don't take your breakfast here
text:
Amazing view and clean room, the bar on top of the hotel was nice.
However we paid an consiquent extra for breakfast, called "continental breakfast", it has really poor choices and have to select one item from a list (pastries or fruit and yogurt, etc...), my husband had stale pastries (from several days apparently). You could add another extra nine dollars for an american breakfast with for example bacon egg and cheese but you also have to select only one item from this list.
To sum up it doesn't worth the cost... Better have fresh good pastries or a proposer breakfast in Manhattan

title: Quiet room with a great view.
text:
Slightly off-center hotel, on Roosvelt Island, very easily accessible via the gondola. We appreciated the kindness of all the Staff. Classic, freshly renovated room with a breathtaking view of Manhattan.
Little choice at breakfast (except extra charge) but very good quality.
The Roof top is also worth the detour.

title: Stay here!
text: Fantastic hotel, cute and comfortable, amazing location that can’t be beat, close yet quiet, really great staff, an excellent choice in New York. Don’t miss the upstairs bar it has great skyline views of Manhattan!

title: Great experience
text:
Very nice stay.
Smily people.
Rest very well.
Close to tramway (we really enjoy)
10 minutes to Manhattan 
The Roosevelt Island is a refuge after days of crowed activities in Manhattan.
Daughters (12 years old) like so much!
Nice views.

title: Lovely property - nestled between Brooklyn and Manhattan.
text: Great staff, the bar is lovely. Breakfast at the lobby restaurant is good, and the rooms are well appointed. The overall theme of the hotel is quirky and quite well executed. Pictures with sound waves of famous speeches in each room are a very smart idea.

title: Awesome View in a great Hotel
text: Roosevelt Island is home to this beautiful hotel. We were lucky enough to be able to enjoy a perfect view of the skyline. Wake up to one of the most beautiful views of NYC. Clean, nice room, super friendly staff and a rooftop bar that takes your breath away with the view. Tables should be pre-booked! Connections to Manhattan are provided by cable car at fast intervals throughout the day. All in all - just great

title: Great stay
text: Staff is super friendly, great area loved the views. Transportation is easy to access so you can get anywhere pretty fast. Would definitely stay here again on my next trip. Didn’t get a chance to visit the panaroma room but the views from my room were still great

title: Magnific Hotel
text: I really love the views,  it was  perfect,  the best hotel that i  visited in my life, evertyhing was near,  metro, ferry, etc.  i will be again soon. So  i recommend  this Hotel for everyone  who looks  for a  great views.

title: Best place to stay in N.Y.
text: Great location on Roosevelt Island with a unbeatable view on Manhattan's skyline. Very well connected to Manhattan through the near-by cable rainway (Tramway) and metro. Very friendly staff and brilliant design

title: Wow great hotel!!!
text: I happened upon this hotel when visiting Roosevelt Island. We ended up staying for a few nights and it was fabulous. The rooms were a nice size and the views were beyond compare! We loved taking the tram to Manhattan. It was very easy navigate!

title: Good
text: Second time here and many things were confirmed. Positive ones: location, panorama from the room and the rooftop, position very close to the Upper East Side. Negative ones: price, no amenities (Water!) in the room, no chance to include the breakfast in the reservation that you must pay separately. The F line was out, so the cableway was the only means to reach the hotel.

title: Great value for money
text: Would definitely recommend! We had a 5 days stay. Staff were great. Changed our room after two days to get the manhattan skyline view. First room had a good view as well, but towards Queens/Long Island. Both rooms were clean and quiet. Fitness room had all necessary equipment. The tram to get to Manhattan is nearby and goes all the time — both convenient and has a great view! You can also take the ferry which is nearby as well.

title: Hidden Gem
text: Loved this hidden gem in NYC! There is no other place like this in New York. The Graduate brand is so unique and such a cool concept. Charleny went above and beyond to ensure we were being taken care of and the valet attendant was incredibly helpful with directions. A sincere thank you to your team and both individuals for an outstanding experience!

title: Hotel charges fees after check-out even though the booking was made through booking.com and all charges were covered
text: After checking out, I noticed that the Graduate Hotel New York used the reservation (deposit) on the credit card to charge me additional fees even though the booking was made through booking.com and all taxes and fees were covered. The hotel did not respond to my email containing the complaint, credit card receipt and booking.com receipt. When I talked to them, I was told that they charged me a resort fee and I should contact booking.com. Although requested, the hotel did not provide any written information about the fee charged. Booking.com did not help either, even though Booking.com is contractual partner and I have been the company’s customer for more than 20 years. Very bad experience!!!

title: Beautiful hotel on peaceful Roosevelt Island
text: We had a marvelous stay at The Graduate Hotel on Roosevelt Island. Our room had a stunning view of the East River and Manhattan beyond. We loved staying on Roosevelt Island and taking the sky tram over to Manhattan each day. The hotel has a fun decor, and is very comfortable and welcoming. The staff is very kind. Don’t miss a cocktail or mocktail in The Panorama Room. The 360 degree view is breathtaking. We will make The Graduate home base for all our future visits to NYC.

title: Highly recommended
text: Perfect place to spend a few days in NY with a family. Enjoyed the cable car to Manhattan. It is just round the corner. We had a room with spectacular view over Manhattan which was amazing to wake up to.

title: FAVORITE HOTEL
text: We absolutely loved staying here and will definitely stay here again when we are ever in New York! The staff was very nice and helpful here. They fulfilled all of our needs, such as needing extra towels or answering any questions we had! Definitely a great experience 10/10 for sure!

title: Overcharge and not responsive
text: Please ensure to capture a screenshot upon completing the booking since the email confirmation lacks price details. I encountered an overcharge at the hotel during check-out, and despite the reception's inability to resolve the issue, they provided an email address for communication. Unfortunately, no response was received. Fortunately, having taken a screenshot during booking, I can now initiate a dispute with my financial institution.

title: New York Trip
text: Views from the 17th floor room were great. Room service for the room was below average. Size of the room was very good. Was not able to use the roof terrace bar due to my daughters age. Location good but few travel issues due to works on the F Line.

title: Always a Great Experience
text: This has become my go-to hotel in NYC. Always comfortable and clean, not to mention the great views and the quiet that Roosevelt Island offers. The beds are very comfortable, and the rooms are very clean and quiet.

title: Great views over Manhattan at this Super hotel.
text:
Great views of the Manhattan skyline from this really super hotel, with exceptionally friendly and helpful staff.
I would definitely recommend. Whilst Roosevelt Island is very quiet - so may not be for those who want the hustle and bustle of New York. But you can reach Manhattan easily by Cable Car or the subway which are both a few steps from the Hotel.

title: Great views, great bar!!
text: Wonderful ambience within a quiet setting away from the hustle and bustle of the main strip. Great views of Manhattan’s skyline. Wonderful cocktails at the well stocked bar. Recommend this place, the staff are exceptional. Access via the Air train!!

title: What a great place close to Manhattan but quiet!
text:
We would return to this hotel. 

The Good:
- Price: we paid $250 per night for a family of four sharing a room - a reasonable price
- I loved how quiet this place was on Roosevelt Island - I did not hear one police siren during our two-night stay! 
- Felt calmer being off Manhattan on an island 
- Easy to get to Maintannan via Tram (one Block from the hotel) in 10 minutes and metro, five blocks from the hotel. There is also a ferry to Long Island City and a bridge to Long Island City. We were a short way from the action! 
- Hotel was Modern - felt new and clean overall 
- Fun rooftop bar - beautiful (over 21s only) 
- Restaurant and bar that was just fine in the hotel on the ground floor
- Lifts were fast and accessible 
- We parked in the Cornell Lot just behind the hotel and paid $25 a night 
- The Roosevelt park at the end of island is well worth a visit. 

The Bad:
- Housekeeping did not clean our room when we were out for the day (11 am to 10 pm). 
- I asked the receptionist about the above and was told that housekeeping had to be requested. The need to request, was not posted in the room or shared at check-in, so we were disappointed to return to a room that needed to be refreshed. A four-star hotel should have a straightforward procedure for communicating when and how to access housekeeping. 
- The bathroom did have a subtle smell of dampness, and mildew was starting to show in the shower by the shower screen attached to the wall (you need to be in the shower to notice it). It just needed a power wash (room 1213). 
- The shower gel was empty in the shower (it was attached to the wall, but the shampoo and conditioner were good), which was annoying.

For us, the good far outweighed the bad - we would return.

title: Great location
text: Great location across the tram on Roosevelt island. Quiet yet so close to Manhattan. Roosevelt island provides proximity too but insulation from the noise of Manhattan. The only hotel on Roosevelt island, the Graduate New York provides the character and comfort of other Graduate hotels.

title: Graduate New York a real treasure in the CIty of New York!
text: This is a hidden gem!  WOW!  The front desk and cafe staff were outstanding.  The housekeeping staff especially on the 15th floor were the finest I have met in my travels!  The room was comfortable and inviting. The views from the hotel of Manhattan are breathtaking!  Roosevelt Island had little foot traffic and the aerial tram is 1/2 block from the hotel. It goes into 59th and 2nd avenues.   There is no other place I have seen that has such stunning views of the city.  Highly recommend.  This goes to the top of my Favorite hotel lists.

title: Amazing stay as always
text: We had an amazing stay at Graduate New York (Junior Suite Room), being the 4th time coming back. We call the hotel “home” when we are there! Staff is very attentive and professional (Charleny the most), views from the room are stunning, the room is very big and well appointed (nothing missing even for a longer stay). Very quiet, which is very important to me, being a very light sleeper.

title: Nice stay at the Graduate New York
text: The hotel is very nice, the location convenient with the tram and the metro station within 5 minutes walking. Despite being in Times Square in 20 minutes with public transportation, the area is very quiet and the view of Manhattan wonderful.

title: Phenomenal "Find"
text:
We happened upon this hotel while looking for a reasonable alternative to  other pricey hotels. While I would not describe the rate as reasonable, it was  comparable to other hotels, and once we arrived, we were very pleased with our choice. The Graduate Hotel on Roosevelt Island is a world apart! The views from our room of Manhattan and the Hudson River were phenomenal. Once you get used to the idea of having to take a sky tram on an off Roosevelt Island, it is well worth the 
effort. (Think ski gondola in the Alps! The views were amazing!) 

The staff was unfailingly polite, the rooms were well appointed (ask for a room facing Manhattan), the Panorama Room at the top of the hotel is not to be missed, and the hotel has a funky chic vibe that is fun to embrace. Our room included continental breakfast in the restaurant, which was lovely, and offered a range of 3 choices. All in all, I can't say enough good things about this hotel!

title: Wonderful.
text: Stayed in a suite with a fantastic view. Comfortable bed, big screen TV. Big bathroom. Quirky decorations. Very laid back atmosphere.Nice restaurant downstairs, beautiful bar upstairs which was closed when we stayed. Ive been there before, and it’s worth the trip.

title: Excellent stay
text: Can highly recommend this hotel. Nice location with wonderful view of the city. Easy access to the city by tram or metro. The rooms were really nice and clean, the staff super nice and we actually eneded up using the restaurant quite a bit due to the good quality food they served. We were very impressed and will for sure book this hotel again next time we come to New York

title: As amazing as it looks
text: Absolute gem of a hotel in a lovely tranquil setting with easy access to the city. The view...omg the view is just wow. We didnt eat in the hotel itself but had food in the nearby grannie annies which was fab little spot. The hotel is worth a visit for the rooftop bar alone. It was also a very quiet hotel which felt very safe! We will be back.

title: Extremely poor service and staff.
text:
The service of the employees was far below standard. If you want to be treated unkindly, Graduate is the hotel to go to.

If you find a staff member at the reception, you can clap your hands, and if someone does appear, it is staff with a long face who all too often tell you that they are not from the reception. Customer service is hard to find here.

The room we had was very nice with a view over Manhattan, but that's about it.
From day 2 there was no hot water in the hotel, so we couldn't take a hot shower for 3 days.

The hotel didn't offer any compensation (even if it was just a drink at the rooftop bar). I couldn't even get rid of an apology. And if you asked when it would be solved, you were actually snapped.

They also do not have tea or coffee making facilities in the room.

The location made the suffering a bit more bearable.

For coffee, smoothies and a nice breakfast, you can go to the school canteen next door. Very affordable, tasty and friendly people.

For a hotel of this price range, I expected just a little more.

For us, at least, NEVER again Graduate hotel New York.

title: Beautiful and tranquil!
text: If you want to spend the time in NYC and cut back on the crazy hustle and bustle during your stay, Graduate is it!  It has an amazing atmosphere and views, and plenty of things to do around!  takes a bit of planning to travel on the MTA, but no big deal.

title: A little treasure
text: What a great little find. Clean, cosy, friendly staff and all in a peaceful location with stunning views of Manhattan Island. Catch the cable car into the City and come home for some peace and quiet at night.

title: The views! The art! Must check out spot hidden on Roosevelt Island
text: I was staying here for a corporate event and the staff were all great to us. Professional, clean, and creative. The sculpture that looms over the reception desk gives you an idea of where you are staying that is both playful and artsy. Rooms and Suites are small but have sweet views of the Manhattan skyline and/or Queens/Brooklyn depending on where you stay.

title: nostalgic stay with a great view
text:
Pros: 
- Beautiful Manhattan views
- The mattress was comfortable.
- The staff was great.
- Room/hotel design was nostalgic of college.

Cons: 
- The WiFi in the room was too weak to take Zoom calls.
- There was no tea kettle in the room

title: Great hotel
text:
The room was great: clean, spacious for two people, and had a super comfortable bed. The shower was clean and had good water pressure.
The breakfast isn't worth the extra amount charged, tho. It was an a la carte method with only four food options and two drink options (coffee or juice).

title: Relaxing retreat from the big city
text: If you’re looking for a relaxing, peaceful experience with AMAZING views, + a plethora of transportation options to Manhattan or Brooklyn, you can not beat staying at the Graduate on Roosevelt Island. The hotel is a complete vibe and RI is a hidden gem. I can’t say enough about the amazing accommodations and hotel staff. We took the team into Manhattan everyday and took the subway back onto RI every night. We saw the Lion King, did tons of shopping, visited 911 memorial, wandered up to Brooklyn for the Jay Z exhibit at the Brooklyn Library, ate everything insight, shopped on 5th ave, went to Rockefeller Center to ice skate and looked at the tree being installed, + just took in all the things Manhattan had to offer…thanks to the Graduate for making it such a memorable weekend.

title: Extraordinaire
text: Un hôtel extraordinaire … une décoration prodigieuse … Nous avions opté pour une suite junior …chambre très propre , vue de dingue … Personnel très aimable et toujours souriant … Le rooftop est à notre sens celui qui offre la plus belle possible sur la skyline … le téléphérique est à deux pas pour rejoindre Manhattan mais une ligne de métro dessert aussi Roosevelt island … on recommande cet hôtel à 1000%

title: Reprehensible Management and Customer Service
text:
Quite possibly the most disappointing customer service I have ever experienced from a hotel manager. I have stayed at this hotel twice a month for the past 16 months and fortunately never encountered an issue which negatively impacted my experience. The hotel used to be a fairly good option if staying on Roosevelt Hotel.

My stays are pre-booked via the Cornell MBA program I am currently enrolled in so I do not have an option to stay anywhere else. This past weekend the A/C in my room was not working and I called the front desk to request help to resolve the issue. A technician came shortly after and tried via multiple attempts to fix the A/C issue. Ultimately, the A/C issue was unable to be fixed and I had to spend the duration of my night in excruciating heat while I was completing a cumbersome assignment due the next morning. To compound the issues, the Wi-Fi in the hotel is atrocious (used to be okay) and I had to resort to using my personal hotspot to get my work done. I give kudos to the excellent front desk staff and the A/C technician who were (and always are) very responsive and attentive to any issues I face regarding the room.

My frustration with this hotel stems from the sheer incompetence from management once I spoke with one of the managers the next morning to see what could be done to avoid this issue going forward. This particular manager (Brian) offered me no resolution with the A/C and Wi-Fi issues I reported to him the next morning. I have connected with some of the other managers at the Graduate Hotel and I cannot blanket my feedback for all of the managers as I am sure there are some proactive and empathetic managers from the management staff. Although I was not seeking compensation (since the rooms are pre-booked via my program), Brian made it clear that there is nothing which could be done (and could have been done) and my best bet was to reach out to the Operations Manager via email so they could ensure it does not happen again. I was told I could not have been placed in another room since all of their rooms were booked out. I was offered an upgrade for my next stay (if it was available) however with the level of dismay I had in reaction to this manager's response I immediately declined and said it is not necessary. The culmination of events which took place that night and the apogee encompassing being offered an email contact (for the operations manager) who I was implored to contact will forever taint my consideration of this hotel for any future stays. I can confidently say that this is perhaps the most reprehensible customer service I have ever experienced.

I would also like to mention the fact that the hot water was not working 2 weeks prior when I had class, and the issue was pervasive across all of their rooms. Again, I understand issues happen however the chocolate bar, bag of chips, and alcoholic drink which was on my hotel room study table was a borderline insult of a gesture with the experience I had this time around.

title: Dirty and gross!
text:
This hotel is sooo gross. It looks cute but I don’t think there is housekeeping. (They replaced a plastic cup I used for water - but they didn’t make the bed, which is fine. I know how. But the dirt and mess still in my room!!!!)
I checked in a bit late at night to find the room a bit messy/dirty. Too late to care, figure perhaps they had one bad cleaning day. It surely would be fixed the next day. Nope.

title: Unique and fun hotel
text: Stayed at this hotel for a girls trip. The view from our room was amazing! Loved the vibe of the hotel and the details are perfectly thought out. The Panorama Room and the first floor restaurant were great as well. Roosevelt Island is a great place to stay. It has some interesting things to see and is super quiet. Super easy to get to the city via the sky tram or the subway. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Definitely want to stay here again.

title: Do not stay here!!
text: If I could rate zero I would.   Worst service I have had at a hotel.  No hot water for the entire weekend with no apologies or compensation given. Staff uniformly rude.  Restaurant open without any hot water (health code?) Finally was told that $35 resort fee would be waived.  Certainly did not use gym without option for warm shower after.  This discount was promised but not given at check out.  I came back to the hotel where they gave me a new statement but never gave me the discount. Spoke to the manager who told me to contact my bank. Thanks for absolutely nothing

title: No hot water -- health code violation - horrible hotel -- DO NOT STAY HERE
text: Was there for a wedding -  Hotel had NO HOT WATER for 7 days.  Management refused to move guests or provide any discount on price.  Two brides got ready for their wedding day with no hot water.  Hotel management is horrible, unaccommodating and rude. Restaurant stayed open with NO HOT WATER (how did dishes get washed?).  Worst experience of my life with a hotel -- do not stay here!!!

title: A quiet and clean retreat with amazing views and great transport options
text: We enjoyed our recent stay at The Graduate. The view of the Manhattan skyline was really spectacular - our daughter insisted on sleeping with the curtains open so she could see the lights of the city at night and wake up to see it changing with the colours of sunrise. The staff were all friendly and accommodating - we asked for the room to be made up each day and asked for extra towels, since there were 4 of us in the room and only 2 towels supplied. The decor was lovely, comfortable beds, everything was very clean and felt new (especially in comparison to a 1 night stay we had at the rather run-down Cambria hotel on our final night in NYC after some other travel in the US and Canada). We loved taking the Tramway to and from the Island - such a great way to arrive in the city, and very convenient to nearby subway stations. We also took the ferry to Pier 11 in downtown Manhattan one day - the ferry stop is just a few minutes walk from the hotel and it was a really wonderful trip. We took the F train a few times as well. There are a few eating places and small shops on the island and while we didn't eat in the hotel facilities, we bought a couple of takeaway coffees from the restaurant. We would definitely recommend travellers consider staying here, it's not inconvenient to get to/from and was a lovely quiet space to retreat after being immersed in the hecticness of the city all day.

title: Management failure Think twice before staying here
text: We too like previous review were informed at checkin that there was no hot water. We made the best of it as our daughter was getting married on Roosevelt Island the following morning. Although we understand that management did not have control over the hot hot water issue, management does have control in compensating their guests for the inconvenience. We requested compensation at checkout at which time the front desk host went to the managers office with our request. She returned and told us our stay would be discounted by 20%. We asked if this discount would be applied across the wedding block of rooms. She again checked with management and the response was No (why not?). She printed an invoice and stated that the manager had not yet applied the discount but they would email me an updated invoice once that was done. It’s now over a week and I have neither received a corrected invoice nor corrections to the charges to my credit card. I have left detailed messages with hotel staff. Management has failed to return my call or take corrective action. In addition I had my family for brunch in the Panorama room it was quite literally the worst dining experience we have ever had. Food was delivered one plate at a time over an hour period. This was an embarrassment for my husband and I as we were hosting family. There were other wedding parties at the hotel. I will say that our family made the best of the situation for the sake of the bride and groom. There were so many missed opportunities by the management here to show guests they care but instead they chose to hide behind closed doors. I would not recommend this hotel for your stay.

title: DO NOT STAY HERE
text:
Stayed here for a wedding and we were informed there would be no hot water at the front desk when we arrived. No compensation or discount was offered as a result. Additionally, the valet attendant was very rude and informed us that there was no parking left either. So we’d have to park at the entrance to the island and walk. No bell hop to help with bags. No help from the front desk. Rooms are nothing to write home about either. Practically a closet with a bed crammed in and without warm water the bathroom is effectively useless. The restaurant said that without gas they couldn’t cook fried eggs but somehow could cook scrambled eggs. I don’t know how they’re washing their hands but it’s not with hot water. 
I loved the location and outside the graduate had a great trip. But this was likely the worst hotel experience I’ve ever had in this country. Embarrassing service and no accountability from management.

title: Location, Location, Location!
text: Excellent option to get away from the city madness but close enough to enjoy it!  Great place with beautiful rooms and views.  Staff was extremely friendly, and safety was a solid priority.  It is the place to stay in New York.  Will be back!

title: Bad experience, and staff were rude. Stayed 4 days for a wedding and no hot water. Booked a jr suite because it’s bigger
text: Bad experience, and staff were rude. Stayed 4 days for a wedding and no hot water. Booked a jr suite because it’s bigger  And received a room that was as big as a king suite. No hot water for 4 days and no credits.

title: Bad service
text: There was during our stay no hot water. No service from the management and not solving this problem. Bad communication. Nothing reasonable was possible. Only thing they said they would cancel our stay on a saterday evening so I could go to an other hotel. .

title: Extremely disappointing
text:
We were extremely dissatisfied and disappointed from the hotel. We originally booked through booking.com bed+breakfast but decided to add our daughters. Since the booking site experienced technical difficulties, I called the hotel from Israel, and canceled the original booking while making a new one for 4 people. At no point was I told the conditions would be different. When we got to the hotel, the front desk told us our reservation did not include breakfast, and even if it did through Booking.com, it would only be coffee and pastries. When we got to the room there were only 2 towels for a company of 4. I tried calling the front desk but they wouldn't pick up. I went down there in person to ask for extra towels.
Our room had not been cleaned and after 2 days when I complained they told us we had to notify them that we wanted housekeeping 24 hours in advance and it is an extra charge. My husband called to say they left us with no toilet paper, tissues or fresh towels and they promised to bring some up, but never did. We had to ask from the room nearby. UTTERLY, COMPLETELY UNACCEPTABLE!!
There was no coffee machine in the room. I bought a mini kettle (they told us there would be coffee 24/7 in the lobby but at 11 am said that's the latest there is any). When the cleaning lady came, she threw away the sugar and sweetener I bought for my coffee.
When I went to complain at the front desk, the 1 person working was busy. After waiting for 20 minutes I asked to speak to the manager. She then said she would handle it, but after saying I had a few complaints she just ignored me completely. I ended up talking to the manager who was sick and that made me uncompfortable to disturb him. He offered no compensation, no apologies whatsoever except for not charging us for the housekeeping (which apparently they charge extra and is not included in the price).
I have no idea why the hotel is so highly rated. It is one of the worst customer service experiences I have ever encountered  (and we travel several times a year). Our mood during our trip was extremely low due to the atrocities occurring in my country, and the staff surely did not help elevating it in any way by their attitude.

title: Long week at the Graduate New York in October
text: Our friend suggested this hotel in New York and it was an excellent choice. After asking, we were given a room on the 16th floor with a fantastic view of Manhattan. The staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms were cleaned and the sheets changed daily. The hotel is well connected to Manhattan by a tram (suspended on a cable) and by a much less spectacular and less frequent subway line. The hotel offers a good selection of food for breakfast, although it was a little expensive. The only negative experience to mention: no wardrobe in the rooms.

title: Not what I expected
text: I booked the Graduate Premium Junior Suite. Prior to arrival I contacted the Hotel and requested a room on a high floor with a view of the city.  They added it to my notes, and I thought I was set.  The day of arrival I stopped by the Hotel and dropped my bags.  They put the bags in an unlocked room with no tag designating ownership and have no checking process, this was surprising to me.  I checked with the front desk and asked about getting a room with a view of the city and they ensured me it was in my notes.  Upon returning to check in at 5:15 pm I was given room 914.  This wasn't a high floor and it had view of the adjacent office building.  I went to the front desk to see if there was a solution, without checking her computer or putting in the slightest effort she informed me that there was nothing else available and rooms choices aren't guaranteed.  I paid over $800 for the night for a room that had no view, the layout wasn't remotely what the pictures show and the furniture and decor was like a cheap college dorm.  I want to say that I have stayed at Graduate properties in multiple other cities and have always had an excellent experience.  This experience was beyond disappointing for the price that i paid and the absolute lack of desire to even attempt to accommodate my request.  I could have stayed many other very nice locations in the city for the same price that night.  This wasn't a Holiday weekend or nothing of note was going on in the city that weekend.  I was just a Saturday in October, where i spent $800 to look at an office building and not get told about any of the hotel amenities or be given access to the Panorama Room, which looks beautiful in pictures.

title: Lackluster service
text: Was not able to make it out to the hotel due to the state of emergency in NY a few weeks ago during the flooding. I had tried to reach out to the hotel and their management multiple times for alternate accommodations but they never got back to me! Also was charged when we regrettably had to cancel. Not the Graduate experience I’m used to - sadly do not think I will be staying here in the future or at any other hotels in the chain. The interior design is amazing but that does not compensate for the awful awful service and customer treatment.

title: Worse staff ever
text: The entire staff from hotel.front desk to restaurants and panorama room are completely incompetent and very rude. I would never stay here again. I spent 40 min checking out and countless hours on the phone trying to get an invoice and nobody was able to help so that to this day I cannot get reimbursed for my work stay.

title: Städtereise
text: Das Hotel liegt auf Roosevelt Island. Dadurch ist es hier, im Vergleich zu auf Manhattan liegenden Hotels, super ruhig. Wir hatten ein Zimmer im 15. Stock mit einem super Blick auf die Skyline. Manhattan war mit der Roosevelt Island Tram super und zu jeder Tageszeit erreichbar. Wir hatten ohne Frühstück gebucht, haben aber trotzdem jeden Morgen unser Classic Breakfast im Restaurant eingenommen. Dieses hat für schönes Wetter einen tollen Aussenbereich, was für New York eher ungewöhnlich ist. Ich kann das Hotel nur weiterempfehlen und würde hier jederzeit wieder buchen

title: Very welcoming
text: Very welcoming on a cold, rainy night!  Excellent front desk experience; delicious food in the restaurant, served by a smiling and attentive waitress; lovely, clean room with beautiful and amusing decor; clean, modern bathroom; excellent bed.

title: Great view of Manhattan. Great location. Spacious room.
text: My family and I have a great time at Graduate New York. It is perfect for travelling with your family if you want to visit New York. I suggest you to choose room with the city view. The view of Manhattan skyline and the bridge is amazing. You can also stroll around the park in the island. The breakfast is delicious. The staff and managers from the hotel and restaurant are very professional and helpful. The team truly reflects the General Manager’s, great characters and leadership. Mr. Malhotra truly cares about his guest satisfactions, attentive, and responds fast. Special thanks to Mr. Malhotra and Mr. Pipkin. If you would like to have a memorable and wonderful time in New York, this is the perfect hotel for you. You can easily reach Manhattan by Roosevelt Island Tramway and enjoy the view. We would definitely recommend this amazing hotel to family and friends, and one day would come back again.

title: Great stay at Roosevelt Island
text: Very motivated staff, Phantastic views. breakfast and coffee very good. The perfect location if you come back from the loudness of Manhattan. Nearby the tram and Metro to Manhattan. We will come back !!!

title: It's a rip-off
text:
1) Aircon was loud and not very effective. It felt more like a road-side motel than a good hotel.
2) The fitness gym is good... but there is only ONE mat for training. Every day the folks in the Gym would discuss how to best share it... honestly?
3) The continental breakfast integrated into the hotel rate... it's a joke. Don't get it.

title: Ruhig mit toller Aussicht
text: Das Hotel liegt nicht mitten im Trubel, man kann tolle Spaziergänge auf der Insel machen und dabei die Skyline-Aussicht genießen. Das Hotel ist stylisch und unsere Juniorsuite war super. Leider gibt es keine Kaffeemaschine im Zimmer. Das hab ich vermisst und vielleicht auch bei dem Preis erwartet. Das Frühstück war gut, aber teuer. Einziger Kritikpunkt: unser Zimmer wurde nicht täglich gereinigt und nach 4 Tagen haben wir dann an der Rezeption nachgefragt, weil uns beim Check in niemand darauf hingewiesen hat. Verwunderlich ist, dass Rezessionen mit selben Aufenthalt die tägliche Zimmerreinigung loben. Da ist dann wohl einiges schief gelaufen bei uns!

title: Overroepen hotel
text: Niet kunnen gebruik maken van de mogelijkheden van het hotel en dan door 3 verschillende personeelsleden 3 verschillende antwoorden gekregen. De prijs was te hoog voor wat er werd aangeboden. Rooftopbar niet toegankelijk onder de 21 jaar zelf niet onder begeleiding van ouders

title: Lovely location but beware of “breakfast included”
text:
Location is amazing with quick access to main Manhattan via the overhead tram line (which gives amazing views). The hotel itself is really nice, clean, comfortable but the only part I’d fault them is you need a booking just to check out the skyline rooftop view… we don’t drink alcohol so we don’t want to sit in the bar but we did want to just see the view and take photos but weren’t allowed to.

On top of that the “breakfast included” is really poorly designed. The options are very minimal and pointless. You’d expect it to include a basic of tea / coffee, cereal, eggs, croissant / toast. Instead it was just bitter coffee, assortment of pastries or a fruit bowl. We ended up ordering off the actual normal menu and just paying extra. So I’d advise not getting breakfast included and just paying for whatever you actually want to eat or going to Starbucks a few mins walk away.

title: Amazing Experience
text:
If you want to be close to Manhattan but want a quieter and potentially safer place to stay, the Graduate New York is the one to choose. With its views and trails, Roosevelt Island is an amazing experience and this hotel makes it even more so. 
The views of Manhattan from the hotel are second to none and this hotel is clean, comfortable and welcoming. I highly recommend it and I am not easily impressed by hotels.

title: Ein besonderes Hôtel in New York
text: Dieses Hotel können wir nur empfehlen, es ist toll gelegen auf der Roosevelt Island, neben Manhattan. Es ist von Manhattan aus sehr leicht zu erreichen, per U-Bahn oder Gondel. Die Gondel ist etwas besonders. Das Hotel ist ruhiger als andere Hotels in der Manhattan direkt. Service ist super und das Haus ist sehr sauber und gut organisiert. Tolle Aussicht auf Manhattan. Wir kommen wieder.

title: Not a four star hotel
text: This is a four star hotel that's managed like a cheap motel. You will be lucky to find one person on the front desk in the middle of a weekday afternoon---and he's likely to be grumbling that he's actually a back office person filling in for someone else. Lines of guests waiting to check in snake out of the lobby. Staff will refuse to follow up on requests because there's not enough people on duty to help. Rooms are poorly maintained---there was a pubic hair on the toilet seat when we checked in---and sheets are threadbare, stained and have holes (clearly the hotel, which opened during the pandemic, is trying to save money by not refreshing linens). The hotel operates a nightclub on the roof with the result that in the evening guests have to compete with obnoxious clubbers for access to elevators---the hotel maintains a rope line in the elevator bay (this may be another money-making scheme by management to close a budget gap). In-room AC units are poorly maintained and sound like jet engines revving up whenever they turn on. It's all such a shame because the views are great on the Manhattan side and the space is stylishly decorated. But there's no cure for bad management---except new management.

title: Ally is the worst employee of the year
text:
If Ally is your receptionist please call the manager or supervisor and have them take care
If you. Ally is awful. She will overcharge your cards. And she has no positive uplifting energy. And she likes to lie because she said she had seen me there before and she never saw me before. I would have never went back there after meeting Ally. She tried to compare herself to me and comiste her relatives to me. Trying to make it seem as she was superior to me.

title: Good facilities; improvable treatment
text: Very good and beautiful spot. The politeness might be higher. The food options are short and a bit experience. The location is a kind of oasis: almost country side and forest but next to Manhattan. The views are great too.

title: A++++ best location, great room
text:
Stayed here for 3 days. it is the only hotel that I know of on the island and it has a terrific location next to Tata and Cornell Tech.
They have a rooftop bar and scenic overlook. It's so busy with everyone coming to the elevator to go up there and look, they actually have an attendant at the bottom of the elevator filtering people in. If you want to eat up there or have cocktails, you need a reservation for sure!
The room itself was not spectacularly large, but they did have free coffee on the main floor in the morning. they do have a gym, however, we did not have time to use it.  Everything was clean and we got plenty of towels for the 3 of us period I would highly recommend.

title: City Gem
text: The Graduate on Roosevelt Island is a great getaway that keeps you in the heart of the city but away from all the hustle and bustle. Great rooms with a view! The Graduate will be the first option we consider when we travel to NYC again.

title: OK si vous ne souhaitez une petite chambre au calme avec une belle vue , no way si vous voullez plus !!!
text:
Chambre très petite pour 4 personnes avec peu de facilités (armoire, place pour les valises, prise USB )
Accueil très impersonnel pour ne pas dire froid.
Petit déjeuner inclus : c'est une blague : on a droit juste à un café lavasse façon américaine et un seul choix entre salade fruit ou yaourt ou céréales (ils appellent cela petit dejeuner continental) ; tout les reste (c'est à dire l'essentiel : pain, viennoiseries, jus de fruit, oeuf, etc ...) est en option payante et chere, trop chere pour la qualité
Enfin il existe un bar en roof top dont l'experience a été désastreuse. Nous sommes montés à 21h30 pour nous détendre ; une fois avoir payé 20 USD pour un cocktail foireux (déjà préparé dans une bouteille en plastique .. chapeau le barman), on nous a expliqué que nous ne pouvions pas nous asseoir sur les tables ayant un panonceau "réservé" ... tout le lounge était vide .. me demands bien qui attendait pour s'assoir la haut dans un bruit d'enfer ... anyway, nous avons trouvé une petite table sans ce pannonceau, mais 2 mn après y avoir posé nos fesses, on nous as dit plutot sechement de dégager . Comme nous etions fatigués et ne pouvions rester debout après un long voyage, nous avons protesté, ne voyant pas qui nous pourrions géner,assis dans un lounge pratiquement vide ; nous avons été menacés avec virulence d'appeler la sécurité (nous sommes un couple de 60 ans .. très grosse menace en effet ...) . Bref, une absurdité totale, qui doit sous doute expliquer le peu de succès de ce bar dont le seul atout est la vue du 18eme etage ... qui est aussi bien au 15e étage où était notre chambre ...
Je ne suis pas un habitué des longues story sur les avis des sites touristiques, mais là ca dépasse l'imagination

title: Un séjour mémorable !
text: Un séjour mémorable ! L’emplacement de l’hôtel est remarquable !! A deux pas du métro et du téléphérique, à seulement 10 minutes de métro du centre ville ! Idéalement placé sur la ligne F !  la vue est incroyaaaable sur Manhattan dès la sortie du métro ! Le cadre sur l’île est très agréable et quel plaisir de s’éloigner un peu du bruit et de la chaleur du centre ville ! C’était formidable ! Seul petit point à savoir, le petit déjeuner continental est très simple, pas de buffet, peu de choix mais une grande qualité ! Il suffit de demander pour avoir des toasts au lieu des pâtisseries, il y a aussi plusieurs sortes de granola !! Il faut demander :-) les fruits étaient excellents et le service impeccable 👌🏻 pas de buffet donc bien mieux pour la planète mais nous aurions tout de même apprécié pouvoir avoir des fruits ET des céréales par exemple :-) Nous y retournerons les yeux fermés !! Je conseille vivement cet hôtel pour les familles ou ceux qui souhaitent un peu de calme

title: Amazing experience
text: I was planning a 4 days stay In NY with my family. After very poor recommandation in a different platform Booking suggested the graduate hotel that I didnt know. But the pictures was nice. We stayed there for 4 nights and it was just Amazing. Nice hotel caring staff beautiful view on Manhattan a tram that can get you to Manhattan 2nd avenue, just perfect

title: Horrible Manager, Brian
text: The Hotel is a nice hotel and the general staff are very helpful. However, the Manager, Brian is arrogant, unresponsive and unprofessional. There was an issue with the reservation and Brian was unwilling to help resolve the issue. Thank goodness a 3rd party and some helpful staff helped to resolve the issue satisfactory. (Brian had no idea how to handle a 3rd party reservation)

title: Great hotel with just one minor disappointment
text: Loved the interior design and especially the views from the room. Gave 4 stars instead of 5 simply because when we entered the room there was dust on almost all the surfaces. Bathroom, beds and linen were very clean but dust on tables and furniture ruined just a little the impact of an otherwise gorgeous room with stunning views. Loved the location: it was great to experience the tranquillity of being on an island with a lot of green areas and at the same being an easy reach to the main Manhattan spots using public transport and the lovely aerial tramway.

title: Great hotel, perfect view above Manhattan
text: Roosevelt Island is perfect for everybody who likes to stay Nest the city but prefers a less noisy surrounding. The hotel is cool, the view is great. Would go there again and recommend it to everybody.

title: Nice, but forced to pay 20% gratuity
text: Overall the hotel was nice, with a rather small 2 Queen size bed rooms. Sport facility was good. Everything was ok, except the enforced payment of 20% gratuity, when you pay for the rather expensive (12$ for some cut fruits) breakfast. You cannot chose to not pay the 20% gratuity, but you can additionally tip. I pay for room and breakfast. Hotel pays the waiter. Ishould not be forced to pay the employees. I should be the one to chose how much gratuity I grant. Maybe 20%, but maybe 10% or nothing. This has become a bad manner .

title: New York City 2023
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the hotel. We arrived at a little bit after 2 o’clock, and fortunately our room was ready early so we were able to check in right away. Everyone was it was very helpful and friendly. The elevators were pretty quick, you didn’t have to wait real long.

title: Eh....
text: Cute lobby, Daytime front desk people and security personnel are very nice and welcoming.  Bartenders are super rude. No where to get a drink or snack if you arrive after 9:55pm. Rooms are not cleaned daily so you have to request towels from desk each day. Daily Facility is bogus. For $39 you get a cup of coffee, "Free" wifi, and a discount at a store you most likely will not be shopping at.  Easy to get to from subway or tram. Uber/taxi drivers will refuse service to island or double charge you.

title: Great staff, great location!
text: I stay at The Graduate hotel frequently as it is on the grounds of the Cornell University Tech Campus where I teach several times each year. I can say that the staff are really wonderful: friendly, attentive, and always helpful. The property itself is quite new and well-appointed. The rooms are very comfortable and all appear to have glorious views of Manhattan. Roosevelt Island is a great location: one F-Train subway stop away is Lexington and 63rd and easy to get to JFK.

title: Perfect stay
text: Amazing hotel and staff! We had an wonderful 4 night stay, room was cleaned upon request (which we rather prefer this). Very nice room (junior suite) with stunning view over Manhattan and the bridge! Thank you for our wonderful stay!

title: Large rooms for NY!
text:
The location of this hotel, on Roosevelt Island, has some benefits.  First, it's very quiet!  Even though the Queensborough bridge is right outside, we did not notice any traffic noise.  It is easily accessible by transit, either via the unique Roosevelt Island Tramway, or by the metro station a short walk away.
The disadvantage is that while you can walk around the island, there are only a few restaurants nearby.  To take advantage of most of what NY has to offer, you will have to take transit everywhere.  The ferry dock is also close by, providing the option of a river trip to get to Lower Manhattan.
Of course, being a little more remote does result in lower prices!  The large room we had was one of the least expensive we could find for its size anywhere in NYC.  And to top it off, it had great views!  (but be aware the posted rate did not include the exorbitant "resort fee" that I believe is charged by most large hotels).  The room was modern, clean and comfortable.  There was a safe in the room, but it did lack a kettle.
The free telephone calls from our room came in handy when our flight was cancelled with short notice and we had to spend hours on the phone rescheduling!
I would certainly consider staying here again on any return trip to NYC.

title: A hotel with its own moat
text: Very good service and convenient location, yet relatively quiet and secluded. Very clean, modern. Excellent view - you are in the middle of the East River - and Manhattan or Queens are just a few minutes away by subway. Only quibble is that it would be be great if the rooms were a bit larger.

title: Grosses Zimmer mit Aussicht, perfekt gelegen
text: Unsere relativ günstige Junior Suite im 10. Stock war gross (nicht nur für NY Verhältnisse) und hatte eine schöne Aussicht auf die Queensborough Bridge. Das Zimmer war modern eingerichtet und sauber. In die Stadt kommt man nach einem Stop per Subway oder Gondel (lohnt sich für die Aussicht), die in weniger als 5 Minuten zu Fuss erreichbar sind. Die Gegend fühlt sich sicher an und ist sogar zum joggen und kurzem Sightseeing geeignet. Es gibt 5 Sterne, auch wenn es gewöhnungsbedürftig ist, dass man die Zimmerreinigung jeden Tag neu verlangen muss und das „Continental Breakfast“ minimalistisch ist (OK, wenn man als Paar 2 verschiedene bestellt und teilt).

title: Amazing location and experience
text: This hotel was spacious, very clean and had an incredible atmosphere. We stayed with our young kids and loved it! I loved the decor and the staff at the "Anything at All" restaurant. I loved the visitor center near the hotel and that we could take a bus, tram or subway!

title: Great location and view, still some progress to do for the service
text:
Great location for the hotel with a wonderfull view at Manhattan skyline. 
Be careful panorama roof top is not accessible for families and open only after 5 pm . 
A lot of seats are reserved so you may have just a quick glass standing at the bar. 
Breakfast service is not at the same level as the rest of the hotel. Be carefull, only continental breakfast is included when you book it with the room (1 beverage and 1 choice of small dish). Avoid Granola which is nothing else than sugar with sugar ...

title: Great location
text: Great location, excellent views, multiple routes to access the island (metro, tram, ferry, and bus), the island has breath taking views and you can take a walk from end to end so as cycling. The red bus can take you around island free of charge.

title: Everything Was perfect
text: we can only recommend this hotel which we liked very much. the location, view and service were perfect  we were quiet in the evening, without elevator problems and with breakfast included and very good

title: Nice view and clean
text:
A nice place to stay. Clean rooms with good view. Friendly staff at both Front desk as well as at the restaurants. Security was great. 
Great view especially at night from the bar at the top of the hotel.

title: Excellent séjour. Localisation et vue exceptionnelles. Très bons services.
text:
Tout était parfait ! L'endroit idéal pour visiter NYC.
La vue de la chambre était tout simplement exceptionnelle. Le téléphérique à deux pas fe l'hôtel nous dépose en plein coeur de Manhattan, la magie en plus.
Service irréprochable. Ménage effectué sur demande tous les jours. Le petit déjeuner continental inclus dans le prix de la cbambre est un peu léger mais peut être complété à la carte. Ce qui est au final très bien. Déco originale et roof top à voir ( sans les enfants, dommage).

title: Great hotel!
text: Hotel is in a great location, short subway or tram ride away from the hustle and bustle of Manhattan with fantastic city skyline views especially at night. Roof top bar is worth a visit, staff made us feel very welcome.

title: Nice view from the room but under 21s can't visit the roof terrace
text: Funky hotel on Roosevelt Island. We enjoyed the view from our room along the East river and beds were comfortable and the bathroom was lovely. We picked the place because of the rooftop but it wasn't open to under 21s so our teenagers couldn't visit.

title: Great location
text: Great and safe location as compared to staying at Times Square. The hotel and rooms are very clean. Gym room is adequately equipped and very clean as well. Location is convenient with a 5min walk to the F line and only 3 stops away from Times Square.

title: Excellent Stay
text: Our stay was so memorable. The employee was so attentive and welcoming. The food here was great as well. The hotel interior design was amazing. So many things we could take pictures of. We can't wait to come back

title: Staff needs to lose their attitude
text:
Wow, these facilities were absolutely amazing! We loved our views of the city and the location was perfect! Bed was comfy and I enjoyed an amazing sleep in!

I booked two rooms for the family and upon check in the receptionist actually argued with me about how many rooms I had. There was no checking, no attitude of figuring it out; major unnecessary rudeness. Of course, I was right and we did indeed have two rooms, she just couldn't find it, yet she was the one with the sass. I am midwesterner polite, apologizing for everything that isn't my fault.

We left and came back for drinks later on. I was bothered that the staff couldn't get us in to the rooftop bar; we had the same priority as people not staying at the hotel. Sorry, but this is wrong when I'm paying $300/night and the other people are not. Once we did get up to the panoramic bar, again, service was attitudy. Welcome to NY.

After our drink at the upstairs bar we headed downstairs for a glass of prosecco to take to our room to enjoy the views in our room which we had paid quite a pretty penny for. Oh wait, you CAN'T TAKE THE WINE GLASSES BACK TO THE ROOM?! What kind of high-quality hotel can you not take a glass of wine back to the room?! Really quite ridiculous. The bartender said that the housekeeping just throws away the glasses, that the bar and the hotel are different owners. Sorry, but you all need to figure this out. That is not the client's problem in a full-service hotel. 

The breakfast was an absolute joke. Again, we had two rooms, with 4 breakfast passes. We didn't use any of the breakfast passes, everyone got Starbucks while I (mama) slept in. Once they returned I asked my husband to use a breakfast pass to bring me up a simple pastry or muffin from the downstairs breakfast and the staff, again, very rudely refused him. How many stars is this hotel?! 4? 5? And I can't get one muffin with our FOUR breakfast passes in his hand, two paid rooms?! Insanity, Graduate hotels, absolute insanity. 

Gorgeous facility, absolutely no aspect of customer service from every single interaction.

title: Hidden gem in New York on Roosevelt Island
text: Don't miss this great hotel just because it is over on Roosevelt Island!  It is easy to get there on the Tram, subway or taxi!  Reasonable rates, unique and beautiful hotel, and the ambiance is amazing!  The beds and linens-amazing!  Staff perfects.  Views are forever!

title: Graduate Hotel
text: Please avoid this hotel - I took my family for a 5 day break in New York but the service was terrible - rooms cleaned once in 5 days, no clean towels, restricted access to their rooftop bar (which is in fact a nightclub) , no room service at all

title: Excellent value
text: Great location. Accessible to nearby restaurants by foot, right on the boardwalk. friendly and attentive staff members from front desk to restaurant. Loved the unique room designs, view and attention to details, 100% service oriented.

title: Do not waste your time here
text:
This was the worst experience ever. We got a hotel room through a third-party service for a staycation and, when we got there, the air conditioning was incredibly loud, to the point where it was the only thing you could hear. 

After the technician told us it was not fixable, we asked if a refund was possible. Brian at the front desk said they couldn’t, and that they couldn’t switch us because they were fully booked. 

After insisting, he told us they could only do it if the room was untouched, which it was because we didn’t even get a chance to unpack before we went to ask about the noise. He said he would send someone up to check and we immediately went up there to wait. No one came, so we went downstairs to ask for updates, and he said that the person that checked said it was too damaged for a refund.

They only gave us a refund after we told them that was not true because we were there all along, waiting. It had been two weeks and no refund or update from them. When I called, they said that they had contacted the third-party weeks ago and that they hadn’t done it. Called the third-party and they had no records of being contacted by Graduate in regards to this, so they lied again. And there are more lies, but I would sit here writing forever.

SuperTravel fixed it in a couple of minutes. Graduate wasted my money but, most importantly, my time.

title: Für uns war es perfekt
text:
Der Empfang in der modernen Lobby war freundlich und professionell. 
Die Lage des  Hotels war für uns perfekt. Unsere  gebuchte Suite mit einem tollen Ausblick  (13.OG) mit Blick nach Manhattan  war fantastisch.. Die Lage fand ich super und ruhig. Der Einrichtungsstil ist modern, mit genügend Platz für sämtliche Reiseutensilien

Das Bett war bequem. Das Bad mal anders, großzügig  mit ausreichend Platz. 
Das gebuchte Frühstück war gut . Der Einrichtungsstil in der Lobby und des Restaurants gefiel uns super. Hervorragend ist die Rooftopbar. 
Nach mehreren Aufenthalten in N.Y. werden wir gerne hier wieder einchecken. Das Hotel überzeugte uns vollkommen. Mit der nahegelegenen Subway erreicht man in Kürze alle Highlights. Ein besonderes Highlight ist sowieso die nahegelegene Seilbahn nach Manhattan.

title: Staff lacks Hospitality training
text: Staff not welcoming, no hotel over view of checkout time, location of restaurants or what’s available during the stay or things to do. No good morning or greeting to guest around the hotel. It’s more of a bother to them. The restaurant food is good but drinks terrible. Host lack empathy and rude.

title: great stay in New York
text: Great views over East River, very comfortable bed and pillows, very convenient to the ferry service. Continental breakfast was very good, did not eat dinner. Room kept very clean, pleasant staff and good service.

title: 4 nights stay
text: I recommend to not book it with breakfast becasue that was not vakue for money. Use the price difference to have what you prefer. Location is excellent to visit New York. Close to metro and tram. Views are amazing.

title: Best hotel secret in NYC!
text: I travel to NYC to work on the Roosevelt Island Tram several times a year.  The Graduate is the only hotel in the island and is a block from the tram.  So, super convenient!  The Graduate is a beautiful well appointed mid-high end hotel.  The rooms are clean and comfortable.  As I stated, one block from the tram that takes you into midtown 2nd Ave and 59th street.  The hotel is also only 2 blocks from the F train station.  This is super convenient for quick trips to Times Square, and lower Manhattan.  Staying in the island is also much quieter than staying anywhere in Manhattan.  I can’t imagine staying anywhere else when I visit the city.

title: Roosevelt Island
text:
Really like this hotel and how it’s close to the city but also removed. The Roosevelt Island. Tram is about a block away (the sky cable car thing) and the subway is nearby too. The island feels very safe but did not have a lot of variety In restaurants and stores (near the hotel at least)

The hotel staff is friendly and most all rooms seem to have a good view of something! The rooftop bar is a hoppin place and you need reservations for a table otherwise you can walk up to the bar. 

Bed was comfy and the room had all the basic amenities you need. I took one star off because my bathroom wasn’t as clean as I would like, seemed to be lotsa hairs on the ground and a stain that looked like blood running down the bottom of the wall that I chose to try to ignore on my very quick stay there!

title: a vacaton week in New York
text: Very nice, convenient and comfortable hotel, excellent location and connection to public transport, relaxing environment - in addition, from the point of view of the guests, the breakfast menu (continental / american) is very limited and monotonous (every day the same and unchanging), the menu usual in hotels is completely missing of this level and style (morning buffet table), it is a great pity, because the overall impression and rating decreases by min. 2 levels down

title: Excellence all around
text: Graduate Hotel was a fantastic experience from the valet when we showed up all the services and amenities we took advantage of during our stay. My wife and I stayed there as part of a hotel block for my brother's wedding, also taking place on Roosevelt Island. It was not only the most convenient choice, but an excellent experience. The service was great, the Panorama Room was such a great spot, and the all day restaurant had great food. The aesthetic was unique and great. It had such a comfortable atmosphere, both in the room and the public areas. It was an amazing experience to stay an entire weekend on Roosevelt and feel like we were in the city, but had our space and could go at our own pace. The Graduate was the biggest reason for making that possible.

title: Amazing views of the city!
text: I had a suite on the top floor. It had amazing views of the city. Great service overall and the at Anything At All was very good. It is easily accessible by Tram from Manhattan which adds to the whole experience of staying on the island. Also, easily accessible by subway from both Queens and Manhattan via the F train (only that stops on the island).

title: le meilleur de New York sans les désagréments
text: Vous êtes à Manhattan sans être à Manhattan et ses désagréments. A Manhattan car sur la Roosevelt island desservie par le métro et le téléphérique (20min du Metropolitan Museum, Guggenheim, 25 à 30 min de Greenwich village, Soho, Tribeca). Vous avez une vue extraordinaire sur la skyline (Chrysler Building, Empire State, One Vanderbilt) et encore plus sur le rooftop de l'hôtel. Le matin ou le soir vous aurez la joie intense de rejoindre la ville via téléphérique en longeant le Ed Koch Bridge et vous survolerez certains immeubles de la 5ème avenue (tout le monde dans le téléphérique filme, c'est assez magique de jour comme de nuit). Le soir, vous serez au calme pour dormir, pas de sirènes de camions de pompiers, d'ambulance et autres toutes les 5minutes.... ce qui fait le charme et désagrément de NY. Le téléphérique fonctionne jusqu'à 00:45 du soir, le métro encore plus tard et sinon les taxis desservent. Enfin, à 5min à pied de l'hôtel toujours sur Roosevelt Island, vous avez une ligne de ferry qui vous emmenera jusqu'à Downtown quartier d'affaires en 40min. petite croisière ultra cool pour seulement 4 dollars. la ligne peut vous dropper à Brooklyn ou Wall street. Je conseille le dernier stop pour ensuite faire le Brooklyn bridge à pied. Ce ferry fonctionne jusquà 23h. L'hôtel en lui même, très design, très moderne, mais élégant et chaleureux. Hôtel ultra récent. bon  petit déjeuner un peu cher (pas en buffet) et restaurant ouvert toute la journée. Le vrai plus c'est le rooftop de dingue avec la vue de dingue sur la ville. pour boire un drink c'est vraiment génial. Les chambres sont spacieuses ce qui est rare à New York..... sinon seul petit bémol, la lenteur parfois du personnel le matin au breakfast. ils oublient un peu certains éléments de votre commande mais rien de grave. Sincèrement c'était ma 4ème fois à New York, ma première était en hôtel proche Time Square (top mais tellement bruyant). Airbnb bof bof, et troisième proche de Bryant Park (quartier plus calme). Je conseille ce nouvel hôtel. pour le soir, il faut retourner dans Manhattan mais c'est tellement bien desservi par les transports en commun... chaque soir, on revenait en 30 min max.... et on a mangé à Chelsea, Soho, Greenwich, Midtown. une bien belle adresse pour avoir le meilleur de NY sans le bruit

title: Wonderful and different NYC hotel option
text: The Graduate Hotel on Roosevelt Island is a wonderful choice for the budget conscious and the adventuresome.  It's location may seem far from the midtown action, but in reality it provides a wonderful respite for the tourist with trees and parks and few cars and no hustle/bustle.  It's also beautiful to see the city from the Island view with the boats going by and to ride the fun tram.

title: NYC family trip
text:
The Graduate on Roosevelt Island was the perfect location for our week long family of 4 trip to NYC. It’s a quiet, safe and clean island that is a quick tram or subway ride over to Manhattan. My husband and I really enjoyed the rooftop bar. After long days of site seeing with our teen kids we were able to leave them in the room and go up for cocktails. The view is incredible!
The room had a great view of Manhattan. It was large enough for the four of us plus all our luggage. Beds were comfortable and it was very quiet.
I usually don’t sleep well on trips but I did at this hotel.

title: Great for a Group
text: We had a block of rooms at The Graduate, Roosevelt Island this past weekend and are delighted with our experience. The hotel is very well located for transportation options and exploring Roosevelt Island and worked very well for our daughter's wedding at The Sanctuary. The staff went the extra mile and helped us whenever needed, sometimes even anticipating our needs. We would definitely stay here again when visiting New York.

title: Great rooms, amazing views
text: Very nice room with good amenities. Very good customer service. The Panorama Room on top has one of the best views in NYC. Roosevelt Island is a great location for those who want a quiet neighborhood in NYC. The bed was comfortable. The hotel itself has a nice lobby and lounge area. The restaurant was good too for breakfast.

title: Gorgeous views from Junior Suite Rooms higher level!
text: Very playful hotel and I loved staying on Roosevelt Island for a quieter change.  The price is still comparable to Manhattan but easy to walk around the island, etc.  There was one other comment about "breakfast included"...yea that's not good.  Grab your free coffee in the lobby so you can at least get a juice with the continental option.  Then you have to pick EITHER yogurt, pastry, OR fruit.  Seriously??  Pretty cheesy.  You'd be better purchasing your breakfast at Starbucks a few blocks away.  You need reservations to go up to the rooftop bar when it is busy so be aware and no one under age.  Honestly, our sleeping room was the absolute best.  I just wanted to luxuriate in the bridge and city view at night with the lights.  We are walkers and enjoy new neighborhoods and small amenities.  I'd stay here again and eat at other places.

title: Nice room but some communication issues
text:
My daughter and I first learned about the beautiful views from the Panorama Room right after it opened from a person we met that lives on Roosevelt Island. They were right! Likely my favorite views of the city! So when my daughter graduated this month from Columbia, my husband and I decided to make a week's reservation to stay at the Graduate Hotel! 

When I made the reservation several months ago, we decided to get the "Get Up + Go Package" which included a continental breakfast from their Anything At All lobby restaurant. I mistakenly made the reservation for one person instead of two, so I made a reservation change online and also called the hotel to make sure they adjusted it. The person I spoke with ensured us that our reservation was changed to two and that the price would be the same (we were spending well over $2600 for our stay). 

Upon arrival, the person at the front desk said the reservation was only for one person and that only one of us could get the continental breakfast. So I explained what happened but she had no record of it. She said she would talk to the manager about it -- and later advised that the manager said we would have to pay extra for the continental breakfast. It all felt so silly - we are talking basically coffee (which is free for all anyway) and pastries, fruit, or granola. Besides, we had to miss breakfast a couple times during our stay because we had to leave for graduation events before they served it. They relented after all but we felt it was a poor way to start our stay. 

I think communication is a problem in general there because before we arrived I sent an inquiry to the Panorama Room asking about the Mother's Day brunch menu and they never responded. I tried calling a few times and could not get through. So although I made a reservation for brunch, I ended up canceling it. 

As for the room, we very much liked it. We had a great view from the 17th floor, the bed was comfortable, the room was large, and we liked the Roosevelt era decor. So the rating is mainly for the that. 

You can reach Roosevelt Island via the F train or the tram (which is fun for one trip over). Getting there can wear on you over a long time but it was an interesting place/location to stay.

title: Top hotel.  Top room.  Top service !
text: Top hotel : subway very close by - top room : 15th floor Junior Suite : superb view ! - and very good service : every day towel switch/cleaning of the room etc.   Only 1 minor detail: a coffee machine in the room would be perfect.  But the free coffee on the ground floor was a reasonable alternative.

title: Endless added charges.
text:
Door on bathroom, makes a lot of noise and also does not close properly. Cleanliness
was not the best. Floors in the unit and the hallways needed more cleaning and attention. All the additional charges on our bill was offensive. There is no legal requirement for you to charge City Occ. Fee or to forward that to the city. Then charge us $39.00 "Facility Fee" plus state and the so called City tax is insulting. The elevators should have instructions on how they operate e.g. use the pass key and then the screen. We saw numerous people unable to use the elevator. Also $65/ day parking.

title: A fun hotel just a minute from Manhattan
text: SUPER FUN SITE just 5minutes by tram cable car to  Manhattan,. The hotel is on Cornell Tech campus. Lots of sites  a quick walk .  Great visitor center at the Tram station with wonderful staff that helped plan our island visit.  Their website is rihs.us

title: Roosevelt Island
text: We had a great experience. Everyone we encountered was helpful, friendly, and hospitable. The experience was fun. Good sleeping on the mattress. Great view of NY Skyline. Safe neighborhood with quaint shopping and eateries.

title: Good location.
text: I loved the location and the room was a good size, however that is the best I can say for my experience. Coffee not served until 7:00 in the lobby and there are no coffee pots in the room. There was a mini fridge, but no microwave. The restaurant was absolutely awful.  It seemed that the hotel was geared towards the people visiting the Panorama Room and not the guests of the hotel. The elevator area was often blocked with people visiting the panorama room and all the elevators would often be sitting at the 18th floor. There is no housekeeping services unless you request it.  The shower setup is strange and our bathroom would flood unless you used the handheld portion only. I loved Roosevelt Island and was thankful to have such a peaceful location it’s unfortunate that it is the only hotel on the island.

title: Magic except the breakfast
text:
the pre-paid breakfast is not rich enough and pre-determined: Western or American and you cannot change.
If you are an eater, take more, it is more filling for the same price
it is not said in the booking

title: Fantastique séjour en famille
text:
Merveilleux séjour dans l'hôtel la semaine dernière. Chambre très calme au 15eme étage avec vue fantastique sur la Skyline de Manhattan. Magnifique de jour comme de nuit. Personnel très accueillant avec une mention spéciale pour Ally a l'accueil et aux personnes du petit déjeuner entre le 26 et le 30 avril. Toutes adorables ! Le petit déjeuner est délicieux, granola maison, des viennoiseries qui changent chaque jour, des plats salés énormes si vous prenez le petit déjeuner américain.
Mes enfants et moi avons adoré et étions ravis de revenir vers l'île chaque soir après les grosses journées de visite.
Juste derrière l'hôtel il y a l'arrêt du ferry de la ligne Astoria qui permet de revenir de Manhattan sud par la mer, a faire ! Le métro et le funiculaire vous emmènent vers Manhattan très rapidement.

title: Fantastic stay and wonderful staff
text: A fantastic stay during 6 nights. Wonderful view from the room, delicious breakfast, both continental and american. Warm welcome and useful advices every day. Spécial thanks to Ally at welcome desk and staff présent at breakfast.

title: Mildewy showers
text:
Very Underwhelming and not worth the amount of money paid.

The waiters at anything at all were wonderful and friendly.  However, I'm extremely disappointed with  my room, specifically the bathrooms, I stayed for 2 nights, and on the 1st night, I asked for the bathrooms to be cleaned cause there was mildew  in the shower. It was not. The room had been tidy, but the shower was not addressed.

If I had another chance , I would not stay at the graduate again for the amount of money spent, I could have stayed somewhere in time square.

title: meglio che stare a Manhattan
text:
Hotel comodo, vista stupenda, parco sottostante bellissimo, teleferica diretta per Manhattan.
Indaginoso entrare nel Bar panoramico, nessuna possibilità per un caffè ( non c'è il bollitore solito in stanza in stanza, nè giu' in sala prima delle 7)

title: ¡Ojo con la limpieza! Hotel muy standard con unas vistas espectaculares
text:
La limpieza de las habitaciones es su mayor y gran defecto. La ubicación y las vistas son su fortaleza y por eso sube la nota. El personal del restaurante es fantástico (Miguel y Karina). En recepción son correctos, sin más.
Nos encontramos nuestra habitación sin limpiar una noche cuando volvimos y al reclamar no les extrañó, al parecer pasa con frecuencia. Nos compensaron sin cobrarnos los desayunos.

title: Very nice hotel! Best in NY ?
text:
Fantastic view and space. The hotel look new inside. It was easy to transport to Manhattan with the tram and subway. 
There is a shop besides the subway station where to bay candy and food. 
The hotel are very quiet. With restaurant  and also other restaurants on Roosevelt island.

title: Great property, great views
text: Great property, great views, great location.  Front desk / check-in staff was a bit indifferent, not what I would expect of a hotel of this tier.  Room was a little small, but the most comfortable I've ever been in.

title: Location is excellent
