text: Location was excellent and room was clean & comfortable space. But no super market or restaurant around there. You can use metro till late night. Staffs are friendly but no response for my e-mail messages.

title: Island retreat in the City
text:
While the views of the city from the Graduate Roosevelt Island are spectacular, it is only part of what makes this hotel my new favourite place to stay in NYC. 
It is way more convenient for access to the city than you might think. With a metro pass you have access to both the F train and the tramway within a few minutes of the hotel that run very frequently and give you access to the whole city. The tramway is a unique and beautiful ride. There is an also a trader Joes right across the water under the Tramway bridge. 
The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful but my favourite part of staying here is the break it gives you from the noise and bustle of the city. It’s literally in a park setting beside Cornell University.

title: Great stay at the Graduate Hotel, Roosevelt Island
text: The perfect place to stay if you have business or pleasure on Roosevelt Island. The rooms are very comfortable and  views are spectacular. All of the staff were friendly and extremely helpful. Quick walk to the Tram or F train, convenient location. Perks, in room fridge, on site bar and restaurant, large lobby area where you can plug in your laptop and work.

title: Great Hotel
text: Located on Roosevelt Island you are in the middle of the city in no time. Spectacular view from the Panorama Bar. Rooms with big windows for a great view. Would definitely go again. Tram and Subway nearby or just take the ferry and enjoy the ride to your chosen destination.

title: Lovely
text: It was a lovely hotel. It is a lovely island and conveniently located via public transportation to LGA and downtown Manhattan. The staff are lovely people. The food at the hotel restaurant should be avoided because it is very average and you will pay too much money.

title: Never again
text: Dirty room and bathroom, full of fungus in the walls The breakfast was a bad  joke and we had to wait almost 45 minutes to have a seat.Staff very kind but not enough;  The hotel is overbooked and employees do not have the capacity to serve so many people.

title: Excellent Hotel Epic Views
text: Excellent hotel, helpful friendly staff amazing views across to Manhattan. Great Island to come back to in the evening to relax, recommend the sliders at Grannie Annie’s. Brilliant overall location, very easy to access via cable car and ferry

title: Hôtel au top recommande à 200%!
text:
La vue sur Manhattan est exceptionnelle !
Le petit déjeuner est copieux avec 3 choix différents entre un mélange de pâtisseries, des céréales (excellentes !) avec lait ou yaourt ou des fruits. Tout ça accompagné d'un jus d'orange.
Café disponible toute la matinée dans le hall d'accueil.
La literie est de très bonne qualité.
Le personnel est adorable !
Aucun fausse note, nous recommandons à 200%!!!!

title: Weekend Getaway
text: The graduate was recommended by friends that stayed this summer.  Very convenient location for us and our NYC activities.  The convenience of both the tram and the subway stop made it very easy.  The hotel itself was super clean. Our king room with a manhattan view was perfect.  The staff were all super friendly and approachable. We will certainly be back.

title: Wonderfull stay
text:
Wonderfull hotel with super friendly staff,spectacular views from rooms and rooftopbar.
we liked it very much! The rooms and the beds were very comfortable! Eurpean breakfast was ok. We always took american breakfast.
I would return directly.

title: Cool place to stay
text: I love the location of the hotel. It is very close to the City but in a quiet surroundings. The Tram and subway ( the F line ) serve the island.  The views are unbeatable. The hotel's decor is very cool. Had a junior suite which was big, the king bed was very comfortable. There's a rooftop bar Panorama. And a restaurant that serves delicious food.  The staff was very nice and accommodating!

title: The best
text: Very good had a great time the roof top bar is the best has the best views of the city . The drinks were great and the room was fantastic definitely recommend and close to subway easy to get around New York

title: Great place to stay....
text: Superb venue for our workshop and also for visiting NY.  The hotel is welcoming with bright interesting decor.  Staff were so helpful and friendly - front desk and restaurant.  One tiny issue is no decaff coffee was available .... this can be easily remedied I'm sure.  Would definitely recommend the hotel especially given its location and superb views.

title: Great Stay at The Graduate
text: If you are looking for an accommodation during a visit to NYC, The Graduate on Roosevelt Island is a wonderful choice. Our two-night stay was excellent. We had a terrific clean and modern room on the 15th floor overlooking the East River and a marvelous view of Manhattan. We appreciated how quite it was! Every staff member was pleasant. The F train was a 5-10 minute walk away. On a future visit, we hope to try the tram! You simply cannot go wrong staying at The Graduate!

title: Nice hotel but experienced some issues
text: We LOVED the location and were generally happy with our interactions with staff at the front desk and in the hotel but had a few substantial issues that should be addressed by management. We were overcharged for breakfast in the restaurant and it took several interactions with staff to resolve. This was concerning. As well, we were missing items from both our rooms after housekeeping had been in our rooms and a suitcase was tampered with. We are also disappointed in not having a kettle in the rooms for tea and coffee. The coffee/tea in lobby wasn't there during the day (only morning) and wasn't of the quality that one would expect at this caliber of hotel (i.e. Lipton tea when it should be a good quality brand). This would greatly improve the experience for guests. Also, really disappointed in the "facility fee", this should be eliminated or added onto the price of the room. It is an additional fee that doesn't make sense and is a whopping $39/night or you should pay it if you use the gym maybe? We ate at the Cornell Cafe just across the path (1 minute walk) from the hotel a few times which was really good value. So, although we loved the decor and the great location, I have a few reservations about fully recommending this place given the issues that we had.

title: What a hidden gem!
text: Unique property with tons of fun whimsical touches throughout.  Grilled chicken sandwich and burger in the restaurant are superb! My guestroom was sparkling clean and the bed was super comfy. The view was amazing! The location was much easier to get to than I thought it would be. Easy to get to the city.  I attended a reception in the Panorama room- WOW!  Talk about events with a view!

title: EXTRAORDINARIA EXPERIENCIA
text:
Muy lindo hotel. Nuevo, funcional, buenas habitaciones, linda arquitectura, bellisima vista al East  River, Manhattan y Queens. La ubicacion, tan cercana a Manhattan (a 10 minutos en Tranvia o en Metro), genera estar en un ambiente tranquilo, sin trafico, con parques y naturaleza.
Volvere feliz ¡ Altamente recomendable¡

title: Views!
text: The decor of the hotel and the view from the suite was amazing. You have to experience the Panarana room also. Food was good and the customer service was great. Will definitely be back! Love seeing the Hebru sculpture in person!

title: Hidden Gem
text: Roosevelt Islands only accommodations, this beautiful hotel boasts easy access to transportation, beautiful views of the Manhattan skyline, a rooftop bar, and great food! I would stay here again in a heartbeat!!

title: Rooftop lounge in Roosevelt Island, NY
text:
PANORAMA ROOM REVIEW ONLY.  Nice rooftop lounge to grab cocktails and get a pretty view of NYC!  Came here Saturday night with friends—we got a Resy reservation but it wasn’t too crowded when we got there.  They have a live DJ and play pretty good music.

Drinks were okay—a bit pricey—cocktails start off at $20 a drink and our basic tequila shots were $16 each.

Location wise, it’s a bit out of the way if you’re coming from Midtown NYC area.

title: Beautiful Hotel!
text: Amazing location! Friendly staff and beautiful, clean rooms with the best views of the city. Our daily commute via air tram added to our experience and was steps away from the hotel. The rooftop bar is the cherry on top with some of the best views in the city in an electric atmosphere. 10/10 we’ll be back! Shoutout Anthony at the front desk!

title: Fantastic stay at Graduate Hotel Roosevelt Island NY
text: This is a fantastic hotel--bright, clean, comfortable rooms, amazing views, luxury at great value. *Very* comfortable beds. Wonderful windows and light overall, but room easy to darken at night; entire hotel feels spacious and bright. Incredibly tasty breakfast--one that really makes you *want* to eat breakfast at the hotel. *Extremely* kind, friendly, helpful front desk staff! Incredible location just steps from tramway over river, ferry boat, and subway. From hotel, arrive in Manhattan Upper East Side or Queens in just a few minutes by tram, subway, or ferry; trip by aerial tram and ferry an attraction in themselves. Great place to stay for business, couples trip, or family vacation with kids. First-rate experience!!

title: Highly recommended
text: Roosevelt Island is so beautiful, the pics are amazing but in person it’s even more beautiful. The staff here made me and my daughters 5 day stay as comfortable as possible. The area is safe and within walking distance of the subway, NYC Ferry, and restaurants. Please stay here you won’t regret it!

title: Best pl@ce to stay in Manhattan
text: Staff and local team were very good, in fact all were exemplary. Great location, great service and great views, with excellent facilities. Special thanks to Ali for her initiative and excellent customer service. We used the ferry 3 times to Wall Street and the tram every day. Fantastic.

title: Hotel is very oddly run
text: I had a bottle of wine I needed opened in order to drink in my room. The employees at the restaurant bar refused to open the bottle unless I paid a $15 corkage fee. They claimed there were liability issues. Never had this happen to me at a hotel before. Pretty sure the employees were full of BS. Fix your hotel.

title: Currently the best hotel
text: Clean, spacelous rooms with stunning views. Wonderful location on Roosevelt island, perfectly located for visiting midtown. I can recommend room no 1101. so beautiful, that I didn't want to leave anymore

title: tres decu
text:
2 em sejour dans cet hotel et tres decu par l acceil et la propreté
l
l hotesse du petit dej etait tres desagreable et tres peu bienveillante
l hotel ne retape pas les chambres automatiquement durant le sejour !

title: Weekend stay
text:
The graduate hotel was really good & very was nice. Just beware of the $250 deposit you have to do at the hotel & the $80 facility fee.

Other than that the stay is great nice restaurant & panorama room/bar.

title: Serenely cheerful!
text: Clean, secure, perfect location! Welcoming, cheerful staff! Comfortable spaces to work or socialize. Food is delicious. Panoramic bar has great vibe and the view is fantastic. Plenty of room to have a group and cost spots for two!

title: Super super hotel
text: Myself and my husband stayed at this house for 5 nights , absolutely amazing place to stay, it was everything and much more . Love it 🥰 tram 2 minute walk from the hotel to the city. Then walking distance to all the main attractions, subway access easy . Really great location. We had a blast

title: Loved our stay
text: Fantastic hotel. The views are amazing. Loved the decor and the island was safe and quiet for young children. Had a nice meal at Grannie Annie's around the corner. So quick and cheap to get to Manhattan on the tram. Would stay again.

title: Awesome experience
text: Awesome hotel, friendly staff, great views! This hotel has a lot of character, the attention to detail was impressive. If you want to have the best view of Manhattan waking up book this hotel. I will definitely be back!

title: Pleasant stay on Roosevelt Island
text: Nice modern hotel on Roosevelt Island. Rooms are small but have all the conveniences. Nice small gym and rooftop bar. Close to many attractions on Roosevelt Island. Complimentary coffee served in the morning. Restaurant on premises. Views of Manhattan and the Roosevelt Island Bridge.

title: An Incredible staycation - Nothing short of amazing
text:
Born and raised in NYC, I had never been to Roosevelt Island before this trip. My partner and I did a staycation for his birthday and of the hundreds of hotels in the city/boroughs/Jersey, I decided to go with the Graduate without having any information to go off of. I stayed in the Premiere King room, and it was better than anything I could have imagined. Being on the island itself makes you feel so close and yet comfortable removed from the hustle and bustle of the city. The panoramic views of the city and the bride from the room was STUNNING both during the day and night time. The hotel has such a unique vibe and aesthetic, it gives classy and quirky all in one. You somehow feel like a full grown adult while experiencing your inner child. The Panorama Room - their rooftop bar and lounge - was INCREDIBLE and the perfect birthday brunch spot. It was awesome that we didn't even have to go outside to get to brunch. The place itself is more than enough to keep you coming back, but the staff just added even more to the overall experience. Wendy greeted me with a genuine (because in the city you can always tell when people in the service industry are being ingenuine) smile and a warm welcome. Both her and Rebecca were so excited for me to celebrate my boyfriends birthday there, and they did everything in their power to make our stay perfect. They were so fun and friendly and I would come back again just to experience that level of welcoming-ness.

I loved every part of staying at the Graduate hotel and I truly cannot wait for my next staycation there. I want so badly for this to remain a hidden gem.

title: Best place and best people
text: Every staff was nice and caring. The hotel is at a very good spot, from there you can literally see the beautiful building of Manhattan. It is 100% worth staying there. I am definitely going back there soon.

title: Stylish hotel, okay location but wouldn’t stay here again
text:
Nice and stylish building, views are very nice, close to public transportation, staff at reception very nice and helpful.
The hotel is located close to ferry and mta tram, but it’s a bit challenging getting there by car or taxi, since the island has only one bridge on the queens side.
In the hotel lobby there are lots of non-hotel guests who come there because of panorama room bar, they block the way to the elevators and some of them were drunk and sitting in the hotel lobby. You don’t have any privilege of being a hotel guests if you are any to go to the panorama room bar, you can’t even access the bar floor with your guest card, have to go all the way down to take an elevator back upstairs. Super weird. 
Luggage storage room is self service and not secured, so you have to bear the risk of your luggage getting stolen. 
Overall: there are better alternatives with more convenient location and better price/ value ratio.

title: Kann man machen.
text:
Problem mit Sauberkeit. Der Teppich in dem Zimmer gehört auf dem Müll und nicht in das Zimmer. Den Kriegt man auch nicht mehr sauber.
Netter Service immer hilfsbereit.
Top Lage mit guter Verbindung nach Manhanhatten.
Waren über Weihnachten und Silvester dort. Der Preis war ziemlich hoch für das was wir bekommen haben.

title: Unhygienic and inhospitable. Do NOT stay at this hotel
text:
I do not recommend this hotel to anyone and I will not stay here again. There is no room service, no amenities (kettle, tea, coffee) in the room and the housekeeping policy is not communicated. They will not clean your room unless you put in a request 24 hours in advance (???) and even if you do this they will not clean your room everyday. I stayed for 5 nights and the ONE day I received "housekeeping" they put in the new towels and left the pile of used towels in the floor, did not take out the trash, and did not replace the bathroom toiletries. The excuse for this poor service was COVID19 and being understaffed. NONE of this was communicated at any point in the reservation process, was not told to me at check-in, and none of these "policies" are written ANYWHERE online or in any kind of pamphlet at the hotel.

I complained to the staff and manager and they were condescending through out. Every issue about cleaning I had was responded with "oh sorry we don't do that..." as if I was supposed to know already. I spent hundreds of dollars on this "4 Star Hotel" just to not even get the absolute most basic services offered at even a 1 star hotel which is just cleaning the room....I had to go to reception every single day about this. 

I only rate poor instead of terrible because the location was nice. However since you're expected to do everything yourself,  if you are coming to New York do not waste your time and money here just get an Airbnb.

title: Delusione
text: Hotel molto comodo e con vista spettacolare. Camere di giuste dimensioni. Peccato che siamo stati 5 giorni senza acqua calda, lo abbiamo fatto notare e hanno provato a risolvere solo l’ultimo giorno. Inoltre ci hanno fatto lasciare una cauzione di 100 dollari (non menzionata precedentemente tramite il sito di prenotazione) che non ci è stata mai restituita, nonostante al check out dopo aver chiesto ci avessero detto che fosse tutto ok. Una volta tornata a casa ho chiesto più volte spiegazioni tramite email e non ho ricevuto risposta.

title: Great stay
text: Everything was great! Don't trust the bad rewiews!Our experience was perfect. We will return in the hotel when we will come next time in New York. The room was big, clean, no noises. The staff was kind and professional.

title: Terribile
text:
Stanza sporca, bagno senza sapone, peli nelle asciugamani e capelli nelle lenzuola. 
Non è previsto il servizio di pulizia camera e cambio lenzuola per un 4 stelle è assurdo...
Peccato perchè la posizione è buona a poche fermate di metro dal centro

title: Wouldn't recommend going out of your way to stay here.
text: Hotel overall was fine. Issues with room cleanliness and staff seemingly not caring about your experience. Housekeeping only comes every other day (which was not highlighted in the reservation email) - upon checking we ask that they make the bed everyday but unfortunately this was not possible. Restaurant downstairs (Anything at All) would not lend hotel guests a bottle opener or wine glasses. Front desk staff were very casual and often times it seemed as though you would be interrupting a conversation amongst them to simply get service.

title: Go for it
text: I was skeptical at first because the hotel is located on an island between Manhattan and Brooklyn. The hotel is very easy to reach by subway the island has its own stop. It also has a cable car and a ship which we have not tried. (The hotel itself is clean, the room big enough for two for a week there is nothing to complain about. The bathroom is surprisingly large. Room service must be ordered in advance at the reception for the next day. Only the small (only one drink and pastries) breakfast we could have saved or upgrade.

title: Magnifique hôtel avec vue époustouflante
text:
Très bon accueil. Un petit déjeuner servi avec soin. Attention 2 formules possibles. 
Les chambres sont spacieuses. La salle de sport est également appréciable avec vue sur le pont.
La vue de la chambre est incroyable et celle du rooftop l’est encore plus.

title: Amazing hotel
text: I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who would like to stay on Roosevelt Island.The staff is courteous,  kind and helpful. The rooms are very nice and comfortable. The food in the restaurant is delicious and a nice option to grab a bit before heading out for the day.

title: Greate stay
text: Quiet, perfect view, with tram and subway close to everything. Roosevelt island was new to us. Indoor carpark close to the hotel was great. Really a place we would stay again. We had breakfast that was included -it was good but too little.

title: Good hotel
text: Overall, the hotel is very good and has a cool vibe. Be aware that you must be 21+ to go to the rooftop, because at night it works as a rooftop bar, so minors cannot go there at any time. Also notice that the options for the continental breakfast are very limited and never change.

title: Thoughtful details and amazing staff!
text: Great stay and very warm welcome. The staff was incredibly helpful and accommodating. The rooms are whimsical, stylish, and very comfortable - opt for one with a view! And if you can't get a view, spend some time up in the Panorama bar for great cocktails and amazing look at NYC. The restaurant staff was great and had good hours to feed us while we were working at Cornell Tech... the chefs could learn a thing or two about adding seasoning to their dishes... but that's my only complaint! And, if you like kitsch, check out the cool wallpaper in the lobby restrooms! All of the little details throughout are delightful.

title: Fun alternative to Manhattan
text: We enjoyed our stay at the Graduate Roosevelt Island.  The room was nice and large.  The view was incredible.  It was easy in and out with F train and sky tram.  It was a great chance from Manhattan.  A little quieter and a lot less people.

title: Wondeful place, poor service
text: The place is awesome, with very easy transportation. Hotel is beaufiful, confortable. Service is poor, no towels offered, no room service and very small option for breakfast. Breakfast starts at 8 AM, so if you need to work in NY, maybe you cant get the breakfast.

title: Great hotel. Made our trip perfect
text: The hotel was great. The location is really good. The area around the hotel is nice and quiet but the city buzz is just around the corner. Views from the room are stunning. Breakfast in the hotel restaurant was delicious. All in all a really good hotel and perfect for your NY trip

title: One of the cleanest and friendly hotels in nyc!
text: I stayed at the Graduate Hotel for two nights. I’ve stayed at roughly 10 nyc hotels throughout 2022 and this was by far the best experience. Very clean, rooms are modern, nice & quiet. The staff is friendly and helpful. While the location itself is a little remote, you are right next to the Roosevelt Island Tramway to get you over to Manhattan and you can subway or Uber all over the city from there. Highly recommend!

title: Spectacular view and great location
text: Everything was wonderful at this hotel. We had a little problem with neighbours which was taken care of immediatly. The cheeper parking is really close to the hotel, which made it easy to use the car whenever needed. We had an amazing family week-end !

title: Wonderful stay, incredible view!
text: We had a wonderful stay and appreciated the customer service. Everyone was very friendly and wanted to make sure we were having a nice stay. The view from our room was incredible. The location was very convenient to the subway and F line was easy to get into the city. This is a wonderful place to stay if you want a quiet location with still feeling like you are in the city. We have found our place to stay in NYC.

title: What you see, is what you get!
text: Customer service from the minute we walked in and checked in. The room exceeded our expectations with a view of the Manhattan skyline. Amazing sky bar with friendly mixologists. Perfectly located to the train station.

title: Lovely stay
text:
I like a lot my stay. Nice location close to the tramway, with amazing room facing the city.
Quite area close to the city.
I love the breakfast and the service
The front desk team was amazing.
For sure I will back soon

title: It's not a business hotel
text: Pros: location (thanks to the close F line, you can reach downtown and JFK easily); design/style and view from the room; at least a couple of curmudgeon receptionists. Cons: poor breakfast; late breakfast starting (8 am!).  It's not a business hotel

title: Fantastic location and hotel
text: Brilliant location. Views were breathtaking, staff were genuinely helpful and always smiling.  Clean modern room. Loved the morning coffee in the lobby and the choice of oat milk.   Panorama bar was a real bonus too.

title: Genial
text: A escasos metros del tranway y la línea F de metro. Cómodo, limpio, con café gratis y traslado del JFK gratis. Vistas espectaculares de Manhattan. Tiene una terraza, que también es bar con unas vistas espectaculares de Manhattan.

title: Great location & view!
text:
What a great location for this hotel, and fantastic view from the front side of the hotel.

Pros: view, view, and view... good location near subway station of Roosevelt island. a bit small but cosy room.
Cons: not really... costy?

title: Excelent hotel !
text: Is by far one of the best alternatives near midtown, great facilities, excelent rooms, awesome interior design and excelent crew, very kind and ready to make your stay the best experience, for sure will be back

title: NY weekend stay
text: For those who seek a hotel with fantastic views on Manhattan as well as an outstanding cocktail panorama bar. Modern, stylish and clean hotel. Also very quiet, but you need to go thereby either subway, tramway or ferry.

title: Great Hotel - poor service and poor management
text:
Great Hotel - poor service and poor management
We took a room with Breakfast but breakfast was not enough at all, and we had to add more - better to take the breakfast separately. 
We forgot our Passports at the room - called and were told that they looked for it and did not find. After arriving to the Hotel, speaking with the manager, they went to the room and (of course) found there the Passports. Hotel is great but very poor service and management.

title: Great location, amazing views - but housekeeping situation a let-down
text:
Roosevelt Island is a gem to stay on when visiting New York - you're so close to the hustle and bustle but not right in the thick of it. The hotel is moments from the tram and the subway station; it has a sleek lobby area and a great ground-floor bar and restaurant area (we did not try the rooftop bar that lots of people speak about); and the rooms are spacious with absolutely breath-taking views (at least from our room).
The real let-down though, and the reason for 3 stars, is the housekeeping situation. I just do not think there can be any excuse, for any hotel of this kind charging these rates in New York, not have daily house keeping.
We were informed at check in when we asked that there was no daily housekeeping/cleaning of guest rooms. We were told housekeeping was provided for guests staying longer than 3 days, every 3rd day -  which doesn't really help if you're staying for anything less than that. To be fair, used towels were removed and replaced with fresh towels, and trash was emptied, when we called down to request this. But again, it's a real let-down not to have daily housekeeping for a hotel like this. It's a shame because we would happily stay here again apart from this; and if it not remedied, the next visit to New York won't be here.

title: The Best Hotel in twon
text: Excellent value for money. Wonderful staff! Yeshaira from front desk gave us exceptional treat. Sandy from morning breakfast great service with a big smile. All in all - perfect : clean, service, attitude, room, location, sleep quality, the view from the room

title: Oasis in the city
text: Roosevelt Island is such a hidden gem, and the Graduate Hotel is the perfect get-away for someone who wants the fun of Manhattan but the peace and tranquility that this location offers.  It's truly an oasis in the city and between the Tram and the subway, you are only minutes away from all that NYC has to offer.

title: Unique NYC Experience
text: We decided to spend Thanksgiving in NYC with our son this year and were fortunate to discover the Graduate Hotel on Roosevelt Island, which is near where he is living in Astoria. We were surprised and delighted at the area, the beauty of the location, and we enjoyed the ambience and service at the hotel.

title: Ottimo hotel a 4 passi da Manhattan
text:
Una vista su Manhattan stupenda, camere grandi a 2 minuti dalla metro. In pochi minuti si raggiunge Time Square
Fuori dall’hotel ci sono un paio di ristoranti dove si mangia bene e si paga meno che a Manhattan 
Le camere sono più grandi che negli hotel di Manhattan 
Ambiente giovanile
La colazione non è a buffet.

title: Strategic and quiet spot
text: Our family spent 3 nights at the hotel and we enjoyed the strategic position and the fact the Roosevelt Island is really a tranquil spot between Manhattan and Brooklyn. View of the bay from our room was really breathtaking and our kids enjoyed going back and forth to Manhattan through the tramway. Hotel dining experience at breakfast and brunch was also extremely pleasant, personnel was very courteous and the food very good.

title: Views emaculate
text: expensive food options for breakfast not enough variety, However room is beautiful with Manhattan views to die for. there are a few shops, grocery stores and dine-out areas minutes from the station on the island. Panorama room is brilliant at night - depending on the DJ. Difficult to get an uber or cab to/from the island late night between 1am-6am

title: Modern hotel + amazing views
text:
The Graduate Roosevelt Island is a very modern and confortable hotel.
is 200 meters from the subway and Tram stations, very well  communicated with the center of the city and places of interest.
the room was very confortable ,with amazing views of the Manhattan skyline , we would come back

title: Perfect
text: The hotel is perfect!!! Highly recommend!!! The staff , the view, the rooms, even the coffee in the breakfast was perfect!The location is great, the island is so calm and you can reach Manhattan in 15 minutes.

title: Excelente ubicación y servicio
text: Un lugar con vista privilegiada a Manhattan, de muy facil acceso en el metro o la gondola.  La habitacion es muy bonita y el desayuno americano es muy bueno.  Personal amable.  la Isla Roosvelt es un lugar privilegiado

title: Good quality and location
text: Really nice spaces, good bedrooms, would recommend it very much for young people. The location is good, a few blocks away from metro station. Very recommendable if you will use this transport. Restaurant is ok, the only thing is that before 5 pm is not easy to get food.

title: Wrong Rate charged and No Shampoo/Conditioner
text: I was charged the wrong room rate and the front desk staff was not accommodating. Moreover, did not have any shampoo or conditioner in the room and front desk did not even say sorry or offer a credit.  Lastly, could not get coffee. A line of about 50 people.  Coffee set up poor and very sloppy. Beware. Check your rate before your check in otherwise lots of escalations, phone calls and emails to resolve.

title: Amazing stay at Graduate
text: The Graduate Hotel is an amazing hotel in such a beautiful secluded island with a charm all its own the views of the city and the love of the island is felt the minute you step in the place if you can check it out

title: Très bon séjour
text:
La literie et l’emplacement sont vraiment les gros avantages de cet établissement. L’hôtel est au calme tout en étant à quelques minutes en métro de Manhattan. Les chambres sont spacieuses p/r à ce qui est proposé à NYC. Le ménage est peut être un peu sommaire ce qui fait baisser la note.
Autre plus : du café gratuit est à dispo dans le hall de l’hôtel.

title: Lage, Lage, Lage
text:
Ja, lustige Einrichtung :-)
Ja, teuer, das Upgrade allerdings war sehr günstig und hat sich wirklich wirklich gelohnt. Je höher, desto besser.
Coole Rooftopbar im 18. Stock....sehr cool!

Die Lage auf Roosevelt Island ist genial, man kann mit Gondel der F-Bahn hin. Und dort ist es sehr viel ruhiger als in Manhattan!

Die Zimmerausstattung war komplett rollstuhlgerecht (auch im Bad). Großes, Bad, großes Zimmer, tolle Aussicht auf Manhattans Skyline (wir waren im 17. Stock). Viel Grün und viel Wasser drumherum.

Zimmerreinigung (leider) erst auf Anfrage am Morgen unseres 4. Tages...

Service an der Rezeption ist sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit.

Das Frühstück ist prima; es gibt auch viel Obst/Granola u.ä. (nicht nur frittierten Speck).

Wir würden es sofort wieder buchen.

title: Smells like teen spirit
text:
Had high hopes for this place.  Most I’ve ever spent on a hotel room.  Room was small and view of queens borough bridge was kinda cool- other side of building had nice views .  What ruined trip was our room reeked of axe body spray- worse than a middle school gym locker.   They couldn’t move us out of the room and said they would put a ozone thing in to kill the smell- we asked twice and they either never did it or it didn’t work.  Anyways it was really bad. Also the soap dispenser fell off the wall in shower and smashed my toe.  Heard the panorama room was cool but it was closed to the public both days we were there.   If they had offered us a free breakfast or a free night or something would have made up for it but they didn’t feel
It was a big deal.   Oh well- cool statue in the lobby

title: Outstanding lodging when in the NYC area
text: Would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat and we already have to our family and friends. Cool hotel vibe and clean.  Gorgeous views. Customer centric, Rooftop bar that has to be the best in the city for views and atmosphere. Hotel restaurant is nice (great atmosphere, food is good, but service isn't the best - they need more help but the folks on the floor are trying their best)

title: Great stay for a long weekend in NYC
text: We enjoyed staying at the Graduate.  The location right by the tram and the subway was perfect.  It was nice to be a bit away from the noise of NYC, the Graduate was a great jumping off point.  If you need to go back and forth from the hotel during the day that could get a bit annoying, it worked perfectly for us to spend all day seeing the sights and then come back to sleep in a comfortable place.

title: Nice oasis in the middle of Manhattan
text: I happened upon Graduate Roosevelt Island completely by chance. All the years I lived in NYC, I had never visited Roosevelt Island. Coming back decades later as a tourist, I was delighted to find the brand new Graduate and surrounding complex. It was a delight to be able to spend a night at this quirky and fun establishment. The Panorama Room is quite an interesting little speakeasy style club with a spectacular view. I wish I could have spent another night at the hotel in order to fully enjoy all of the amenities and have time to explore Roosevelt Island.

title: Looks fine from the outside, but don’t look closer…
text:
We knew this place due to a rooftop bar experience this summer. The hotel was good at first but when when we complained about some things, everyone got unfriendly very quick. Housekeeping was ordered but didn’t show up for 3 days, we had no electricity in the bathroom one day and a flooded toilet when we came back from Manhattan…

All in all not so nice.

title: The perfect hotel for location and a good night's sleep in busy NY
text:
I have been to New York many times but this was my kids first time....We chose the graduate based on location,quiet and views from panorama room.
We simply couldn't be happier, from the very first moment at reception (Wendy I think) we were made to feel so welcome,once we saw the view from our room we were blown away,the calibre of the bedroom and bathroom were excellent.
The bonus of having both the subway and tram to get across the river was brilliant as we're the choice of restaurants locally.
I am a fellow hotelier and have to say that the staff and product are exceptional, we have done nothing but recommend your hotel to everyone and will 100% choose Graduate every time we revisit NY.
Big thanks and all the best for the future from The Myers family.

title: NYC marathon
text:
We stayed here because our children were running in the NYC marathon 
Everyone was just lovely and very helpful room views were amazing we truly loved every minute.
We did not go up to the panoramic room unfortunately other then that would recommend this hotel !
The tram was very fun and walking around the island was relaxing and We lies Granny Annie’s !

title: Quiet and scenic place close to the City
text: Clean and Comfy room with an incredible view. Great and quiet location, few minutes away from Manhattan. Highly recommended the short tramway (cable car) into Manhattan. Amazing Lobby space with a lot of seating where to chill and recharge your phone!

title: Well located
text:
Quite and nice place, the location is a must.  Good transportation to go in and out of Island.
The surrounding areas make to stay at Graduate an experience itself, parks, museums, restaurants and the lighthouse, and the views from it completely worth it.

title: Great view is the ONLY plus
text: Stayed here because it was close to the person I came to see and recommended as a less expensive.  It wasn't.  I could have stayed in Manhattan at a top hotel for the same price.  They do not automatically clean rooms...You have to ask.  They have no room service.  I upgraded to a Junior suite and it was ok.  The view was great (about the only thing I really liked).  The suite had a small table to write on (the desk plotter was kind of scratched up).  There was a small sofa and TV stand.  The bed was nice but not very long.  There was no light at the bathroom mirror and the wall paper had little people on it and was kind of wired.  There were separate pictures of Bonnie and Clyde on the wall?  The first time I called the front desk they did not answer and the phone just kept ringing.  When I called the front desk the next morning, they put me on hold so long I gave up and just came down to the desk myself.  I wanted to make a reservation for breakfast and was told they do not make reservations.  The one and only restaurant they have had a very small menue and the food I had (breakfast) was ok.  The service was terrible..we had to ask for the first cup of coffee like 5 times, and then had to ask for cream like 3 times. They were pleasant servers but were just disorganized.

title: Calm with great views
text: The hotel is situated in a calm area and offers great views of Manhattan. The rooms are cosy, modern and clean! We were disappointed about the breakfast offer. It is better to book without and eat out! Few choices and no possibility to order extras, even if you are willing to pay extra. They are very strict.

title: Unforgettable stay
text: Go for the rooms on high level and with view on Manhattan. Unforgettable when you wake up or when you arrive in the evening. Amazing views from the panorama Bar also. Nice staff. Do not hesitate, this upgrades your stay at NY. Whaauw.

title: Perfect
text: Really great location for a trip to New York with an amazing Panorama view of the skyline of Manhattan. With the tramway and the subway you’re in minutes in Manhattan and the Roosevelt Park is also worth to visit.

title: Souvenir inoubliable
text: Personnel très accueillant. D’une propreté irréprochable. Chambre avec vue à vous coupez le souffle : Empire State building, Chrysler building. Bar à cocktail. À proximité du téléphérique ainsi que de la station métro.

title: All “As” Great “GPA”👍🏻
text:
The calm lobby welcomes guests and greets with a delightful decor combination of “ academic nostalgia “ and Roosevelt family historical images

Security from lobby 👍🏻 Must use room card to access elevator (fun student id theme room cards)
Quiet, clean QUEEN size mattresses, and updated bathrooms with fun vibes.
Great rest as no conventions nor loud large reservations staying in The Graduate 👏🏻👏🏻

title: Disapointing
text: The promises on paper weren't met. Behind the lovely appearance hides an underataffwd adress with quite a few issues that need to be solved. Avoid breakfast. Go to the Starbucks around the corner: shorter waiting time, cheaper and more nourishing for the same price.

title: Séjour New York
text: L’hôtel est très bien situé et très bien insonorisé ce qui est appréciable dans cette ville très bruyante. La décoration de l’hôtel est sympa, on a l’impression d’être dans une bibliothèque. Les chambres sont plus que correctes. Le petit déjeuner continental est très décevant, 1 boisson et 2 mini viennoiseries, un point c’est tout! Attention pas moyen de prendre le petit déjeuner avant 8h00. Pas de machine à café dans les chambres , pas de thé. Si vous souhaitez que votre chambre soit faite tous les jours faudra payer un supplément. On sent donc très bien que l’idée de la direction est de gagner beaucoup d’argent mais pas obligatoire de contenter le client.

title: Graduate Hotel; great experience
text: We spent 9 nights at the hotel and were pleasantly surprised by its location; nice and quiet and away from the day hectic of the city. Which was fantastic but to wind down again, the hotel in Roosevelt Island was super. Also the subway is only a 5 minute walk away. Perfect!

title: Great Stay
text: This hotel is in a great location. walking distance to the subway. Easy access to Manhattan main attractions. The hotel is beautiful, quiet, and very clean. I really enjoyed been able to go and sightseeing and returning to the quiet environment of the hotel. Staff was friendly and resourceful.

title: Relaxing stay on Roosevelt Island
text:
I stayed 2 nights at the hotel. The view from the Panorama room was beautiful. The beds were super comfortable. Breakfast at the restaurant was delicious and filling to start out our day in the city. 
I would not hesitate to stay here again.

title: Fun, funky, modern hotel in a great location
text: I have had the opportunity to spend about 10 weekends in the Graduate Roosevelt Island Hotel in the past year. Each one of these visits has been great. The front desk staff are always friendly and now recognize me and know me by name when I come in the front door to check-in or at the end of my stay when I check-out. The rooms are modern and just a little bit fun and funky. The views are always great no matter what direction my room has faced. The Panorama Lounge on the 18th floor has breathtaking views down the East River of Manhattan and Queen's. The restaurant has a smallish menu, but I have enjoyed everything I have ordered. I particularly enjoy the pasta dishes.

title: Disappointed  last few times
text: My wife and I have stayed overnight the last three months . We picked the Graduate because of the location it is to family . The last two times it’s disappointed us. Once tv wouldn’t work and this past weekend I had booked a King standard thru Hotels.com and after check in went to room it was a Standard Queen I know we arrived after 8 ,but we paid for king not a queen and Graduate is not a inexpensive place to book a room . Valet parking is also expensive it was 60.00 the first time we stayed ,so now I just park at parking garage on island and walk to the Graduate . When the wife and I go to visit family we just use the ferry . I couldn’t tell you about the restaurant because we walk to a little place not far from the graduate to eat .The bar is nice with great views ,but usually very busy.

title: Diamond in the rough
text: Pleasantly surprised. This was a Gem. Kid friendly, besides the rooftop bar. From Decor to the staff the location the panoramic view on the 15th floor all made our stay very enjoyable. Thank you we will visit again!

title: Quirky hotel with a relaxed vibe, great location with fabulous views of Manhattan
text: Quirky hotel with a relaxed vibe, great size rooms with amazing views of Manhattan, great location with great transport links into Manhattan, we found it easier to get about that it was staying in Manhattan and MUCH QUIETER! We used the subway and it took us everywhere we wanted to go, even Coney Island which was great 😃 we also used the Roosevelt Island tram for the same price as the subway plus free transfer to subway and the Tram itself was a great experience. Free morning coffee was a great little touch and the only thing that let it down for me was the menu in the restaurant was a bit too high end in it’s choices and quite expensive and no kid’s menu meant we had to pay full price for for my 11yr old who didn’t like anything on the menu, this meant we only ate there once when we would of liked to of ate there more☹️ But all in all great hotel

title: NYC oasis
text: If you are looking for a place to completely relax and enjoy a view of the city after spending a day there- this is it. Staff is very friendly, rooms are clean and fun with great views. Easy access from F train, Ferry, or Tram- truly makes for a totally different NYC experience when you can hop off the tram after a couple minutes and all of the chaos of the city is quieted and you can walk down clean well lit streets to your hotel. Truly gives a feeling of coming home after a day in the city vs going to a hotel. A great way to relax - and the F train drops you right near any broadway show you want to see! the tram takes you blocks from Columbus circle and Central Park. Ferry makes hoping over to Brooklyn or Astoria or Even lower Manhattan a simple boat ride with the option for Beer or Coffee and Snacks on board. Definitely more of a couples hotel.

title: Emplacement idéal
text: Nous sommes tombés amoureux de Roosevelt Island! L’endroit est sublime, offre des vues magnifiques tout autour de l’île et permet d’accéder rapidement à Manhattan tout en étant loin des tumultes de la ville. Et l’arrivée en télécabine est absolument grandiose et fait don petit effet. L’hôtel est sympa, les chambres Junior Suite sont très grandes et offrent une vue imprenable. La deco décalée avec des Eleanore Roosevelt partout nous a également beaucoup plu. Petit bémol avec le roof top: personnel et cocktails absolument imbuvables! En plus, on vous interdit de prendre des photos de la vue sur la ville depuis la terrasse extérieure si vous avez un appareil photo. Par contre, c’est permis avec un téléphone. Ils sont très à cheval là-dessus, ce qui est absolument ridicule. Enfin, le personnel n’est pas toujours sympa et pas toujours efficace.

title: Perfect place to stay
text:
Just in the middle between Manhattan and Brooklyn with very short ways to both sides. The subway is close, ways central points of the Manhattans middle - like Central Park or Upper Eastside - are close by. Even to take the Ferry to Long Island and Manhattan is possible and not expensive. Totally worth the trip to East Side oder full route to Pier 11.
Roosevelt Island is much calmer to stay than in Manhattan and offers amazing views to both sides: Manhattan and Brooklyn. On top there are two parks and jogging along the waterside is a nice opportunity too.
The hotel is clean, modern, the employees are friendly and  I'm happy to come back again.

title: A breath-taking view from a calm island towards Manhattan skyline
text: Easy Access to the island by Subway or tram. You Need a Metrocard! The hotel is very special, the location and the view spectacular. The roof-top bar does not allow under 21s, even nor for just the view! The rooms are Made only on request.

title: Don’t drive here
text: Parking is not easy, there is no driveway for valet. Arrived at night, single women and was first directed to a parking garage 2 miles away and not given instructions on how to take a bus back to the hotel. Finally after calling third time told valet is just double park with flashers. At checkout, it has been 45 min and I’m still waiting for my car. There are also no coffee machines in the hotel rooms. I will not be staying here again

title: Sehr empfehlenswert
text: große und saubere Zimmer, sehr freundliches und hilfsbereites Personal, eine Top-Lage mit Blick auf die Skyline. Ein wunderschönes, modernes Hotel mit Wohlfühlcharakter auf einer Insel mitten in New York. Besser geht für diesen Preis nicht!

title: Great location, super view!!
text: A hotel in a great location with a remarkably beautiful view. The breakfast service and the price-performance ratio could be better in parts. The reception is customer and solution oriented and contributed a lot to our good vacation feeling.

title: Nice facility, but service issues
text: We returned for our third stay at the Graduate and although we like the property, the servicing was poor.  We were not told that our room would not be serviced unless we gave instruction in advance, thus we had soiled towels for two days.  Even then, it took a day to service the room.  We were pleased that the elevator operator did provide preferred service to hotel guests when we came back to see a line for the Panorama Room.

title: Quite hotel in th middle of New York
text: Great hotel, quiet as away from hustle and bustle & the noise in Manhattan, on interesting historic Island with great transport links that get you into Manhattan in less than 10 minutes. Only negative was lack of Tea/coffee making facilities within the room/hotel, which is a big negative for me.

title: Unique getaway
text: We met with family members in centrally located NYC but didn't want a tourist experience. The Graduate Roosevelt Island was the perfect spot. Easy access to NYC but with green space and room to breathe the rest of the time.

title: great experience
text:
amazing views and cleanliness 
they made sure if your celebrating any occasion they gave me a cute snack 
the environment is calm and staff of very welcoming checking in the rooms not a long wait and they tell you where everything is located

title: It could not have been better.
text:
Everything is great. It can be a bit tricky to figure out where to get off the F train to hit the Times Square station. Once you find that, getting around the city is easy. 

The rooms were fantastic. The food was fantastic. The park around the hotel was fantastic. The people working at the hotel were the best.

title: Pleasant stay at the Graduate for fall in NYC
text:
We chose the hotel because we read about it on Loving New York and the reviews were very good. Also value for money is great compared to hotels in Manhattan.The view from our hotel room on the 12th floor was stunning and we could see the skyline on Manhattan from the huge windows. One of the reasons we chose this hotel as well. Roosevelt Island is a quite neighborhood but very well connected with Metro F line or Roosevelt Island Tramway with a spectacular view. 
Friendly staff :-) We would stay here again! Thanks for a great week in NYC.

title: Awful Service and Cleaning
text: The Graduate continues to disappoint.  I end up staying here because it is convenient for work, and I always regret it.  Whether it is the rooftop bar events that back up the lobby and elevators (12 minutes to get down tonight); finding a bunch of old food in my refrigerator when I checked in - and having nobody to respond and do anything.  They have no service anywhere from the front desk on - it is always a wait and lack of follow through.

title: Great new hotel in a perfect location
text: Had a great week in the Graduate. The staff was so kind and helpful. The bed was really comfortable. The AC was silent, the windows isolated the rooms from the noise outside properly. Perfect stay for a trip to Manhattan or NYC in general!

title: Consistently underwhelming.
text: I’ve stayed here a few times, and have had mediocre experiences. The first rime, they charged me an extra $1400 on a $40 food charge. This last time, the waters in my room had been opened, I called down and was assured that I would not get charged. And what do you know— $10 on my bill. Coffee comes out late…. Not what you expect when you think hospitality.

title: Expected more
text: Loved staying on Roosevelt Island.  It is so refreshing after a day in Manhattan.  Transit is fantastic with free bus that runs around island.  Not much choice for restaurants on the island.  Resort fee unnecessary giving no real benefit.  Free coffee stand in lobby was abysmal.  One thing I can say is that it was very clean & has great views.  Room was small like a European hotel room, but served my purpose.  I liked there was no carpet as it felt more clean

title: Adrienne M.
text: Wonderful views, a very friendly staff and a convenient location that's easily accessible to Manhattan. Comfortable beds, nice hot showers and good temperature control in the rooms. I'll definitely return!

title: GREAT POSITION GREAT VIEW!!!!
text: The hotel is beautiful, modern. The position is great to visit the city; the view is awesome and you will sleep perfectly as the island in very quiete  and green. Lunch we did the last day is also tasty in the restaurant which is very comfortable and full of privacy.

title: Highly recommended
text: We stayed here for 4 nights during our stay in New York. The location could not have been better. On the island it is quiet and a bit cooler than in the city. Especially in the summer it is an advantage. The view of the bridge from our room was AMAZING. The hotel is stylishly decorated with some nice touches.

title: Worst service and dirty … do not stay
text:
Dirty rooms. Housekeeping didn’t even change the sheets after repeated requests. Manager has never called back after repeated requests. 

Horrible horrible - do not stay. 

The park bench across the street would be much better.

title: Not the best customer service
text: We had a beautiful view (thanks to Wendy) . However, we don’t feel the hotel is tailored toward accommodating guest. There is more attention to the panorama room than it is toward guest. No we stayed for US open. Probably won’t ever stay again.

title: Personal fantastico
text: Las vistas de la habitación y el trato recibido por el personal fueron inmejorables. Necesitan mejorar la limpieza en las habitaciones ya que no se hace todos los días. También sería conveniente que adelantarán la hora de comienzo del desayuno ya que empieza a las 8:00 am

title: Nice location but not very clean rooms
text:
Staying at the Graduate was definetly a great experience after 4 nigths in Manhattan because of the nice view from our room to Manhattan + the quiet environement on the Island.
Disappointing: the rooms were rather dirty and there was still a used face mask when we entered our rooms.

title: Could be better
text: I booked the hotel for the view but teens were not able to admire the view since it’s in the bar and you can’t access a bar in NYC if you are under 21. The reception should be run more professionally. It’s run by students and they do not have good customers service skills.  Learn from older members of staff.

title: Nice at times
text:
Checking our check in experience was not the best. Customer service is lacking. Also they do not allow you to check in early even if your room is available. The bathroom in the lobby is nasty and it's not kept up to standard. 

Our room was lovely, but it could've been dusted a little bit better. However it was spacious and they customize things because we were celebrating our anniversary, which was a nice touch.

 The panorama room was nice as well;  lots of people though and many from outside of the hotel which is fine for those looking for a club bar type experience. I suggest getting a table because getting the bartenders attention without one is not easy.

title: Poor service
text:
Stayed in a "junior suite" type room. The Graduate Roosevelt Hotel is located on the island of the same name and is the only 4 star hotel. Even though the location is far from Manhattan but very accessible via the subway or tram and the quality of the bedding in modern rooms, this stay was not at all up to our expectations and the hotel failed in the following areas:

- Unprofessional, uncourteous and  rude interaction between the reception team and the guest. As an example, when checking out on the morning of August 28th, I was verbally abused by the person on duty at that time (a woman) because I could not check the bill. This attitude is not acceptable in this type of establishment. I seriously invite Mr Mohit Malhotra, GM  to investigate the problem with the employee in question. The lack of training of the staff who are in constant contact with the customers is undeniable. Is there a leader in this hotel? 

- The daily cleaning of the rooms is not automatic and no one informs you of this at check-in. I am amazed of  this choice made by the management. The worst thing is when you ask the reception in the morning to clean your room and they tell you: no problem, it will be done every day during your stay when it is not!

- When you have chosen a breakfast included in the price of the room, this one is continental and is limited to 3 options. If you want a savoury breakfast, then you have to pay extra for the so-called American breakfast. The quality/price ratio is poor. I invite you to choose a single room and pay for an" à la carte" breakfast.

- The Panorama bar. A security guard escorts you to the bar or selects the floor to access it. These agents are for the most part unpleasant, unpolite and disrespectful. At over 50, you are asked for an ID card as they probably think you are under 21...  The panorama bar is still a must with a great view on Manhattan. 

In short, a very very mixed stay, too expensive for the service provided and a score that will be just as much: 2 out of 5 for the simple reason that you don't insult a customer who asks to check the bill before confirming that the card can be debited. For this reason alone, I would not recommend the establishment unless serious efforts are made and a staff training program is put in place.

title: No Daily Cleaning Service to Save Money;  No right of front desk to extend stay
text: The hotel has a good restaurant but a few of the "profit maximizing" practices of the hotel undermine its quality. No daily or any service in the rooms until you leave. The internet does not work with certain Lenovo computers. And the front desk has no authority to extend rooms.

title: Great boutique hotel
text: This is a hidden gem tucked away on Roosevelt Island. It’s quiet and off the beaten path with a great view of the city. Shared transportation can be pricey as it’s not close to anything. The hotel is fresh and uniquely designed.

title: Coach Wink's NJTL, Inc. 7th annual trip to the US Open
text: Each year since 2013, our group has raised money to help bring 30-40 youth to the US Open. After missing 2020-2021 due to COVID. We resumed this year. Our first experience The Graduate Hotel was great.

title: Hotel on island...
text: great base for visiting the city ... the view from room 1004 is beautiful. Rooms are very clean ... an interesting approach to the definition of a continental breakfast - something that a European understands completely differently than the hotel management ... views, location, communication with the city and quality in the facility reward breakfast served in this way ...

title: Best hotel to stay in NYC
text: clean and comfortable. great view and location is great. My girlfriend and I use Subway and midnight and it was convenient. View is amazing, went many rooftop bar but my room view was better than the bar

title: Never again
text: I would never stay here again. The AC was so loud that we could not sleep and had to move to another room in the middle of the night. At this price range I expect this to be checked beforehand. There was supposed to be free coffee in the morning but we were denied it.

title: Our summer holidays
text: We stayed at Graduate Hotel for 9 days, it’s a very nice place. The island is a quite place close to Manhattan, just one stop by subway, where you can relax after the days trip. There are also some good restaurants

title: Great hotel!
text: Perfect location! Clean and quiet. Beautiful surroundings. Easy access to Manhattan. Nice clean room with an amazing view on Nee-York and the East river. Just an overall great experience, with friendly staff!

title: Beautiful accommodation
text: The hotel is located on the quiet Roosevelt Island, from which there is a wonderful view of Manhattan.  You can take the cable car from the island to Manhattan and we definitely recommend this route because of the views.  The hotel has very comfortable beds, a beautiful terrace, which unfortunately is closed on Mondays and Tuesdays and is accessible only to adults.  The view from it is beautiful.

title: No muy buena experiencia
text: Esperaba un mejor servicio en este lugar por el precio, cuando llegue a mi habitacion encontre cabellos encima de las camas como si las sabanas no las cambiaron. habian pelos en el baño como cuando se afeitan y no limpiaron. los estandares de los jabones estaban vacios. Mi esposo hablo con alguien en recepcion y le dijeron que enviarian a alguien para limpiar, pero durante los 6 dias que estuvimos en el hotel nadie fue a limpiar. El lugar tenia una vista muy linda desde mi habiatacion, la vista panoramica de la terraza es simplemente hermosa, pero los bartender se portaron muy groseros. No creo regresar a este Hotel.

title: Top Hotel Top Lage
text: Perfekt für einen New York Urlaub. Gerne wieder. Es gibt auch einen Kühlschrank und im 5 Stock Eis. Eine super schöne Rooftop Bar. Probleme werden sofort beseitigt und immer sehr  freundlich. Zimmer werden nur auf Verlangen gereinigt.

title: Good, (Sadly) Not Great
text:
I wanted to love my experience at the Graduate Hotel. My overall stay was good (I even hesitate to say 'very good'), but several instances kept me from giving it the rave review I was partial to writing. First, and most importantly: employee training. It was clear from the chaos at the front desk during check-in and check-out times, from the inability of a hotel employee to find a table for one in a seemingly empty restaurant (and his aggravation to boot), from the inability of the hostess at the Panorama Room to lead a guest to the bar or the terrace because all the tables were booked how so many employees were unfamiliar with basic hospitality protocols and ill-equipped to handle essential parts of their job. Perhaps a traditional roll-out of services and amenities during the check-in process would have clarified to guests that they could use any elevator to access their floors, needed a separate card to enter the fitness center, could enjoy coffee and tea as part of their stay (?), rent bicycles (?), claim a wellness kit (?), and were subject to a facility fee that covered the latter three, as I learned when I checked the hotel’s website after my stay. 

And then the rooms themselves — beautifully designed, with stunning views— could have used a little more attention to detail. How about a coffee pod machine for a morning pick-me up, or a piece of hotel paper and a pen that the guests could take home as a memento of their stay?  Small details like these—in addition to making sure there’s enough toilet paper and body wash— go a long way in crafting a unique experience for guests. 

Judging from the mountains of luggage behind the front desk, it’s likely that my stay coincided with a particularly hectic weekend. The check-out process was no less chaotic, with guests filing in at once, unsure where to go, while a lone employee tried to move the line as quickly as possible. A speedy process that was efficient on the surface was anything but, as I never got a chance to review the room and restaurant charges and wrongly assumed I would receive an email receipt with the breakdown (still waiting). 

All in all, I was ready to enjoy my stay and recommend the hotel to a friend or colleague. While I would still do the latter, such a recommendation would inevitably come with the aforementioned caveats—caveats that could make others pause before they book their stay. The Graduate Hotel at Roosevelt Island has found its aesthetic: sleek, cool, slightly bookish. But it has yet to find its footing. I sincerely hope it invests in training their employees and staff so that they in turn can make the experience a memorable one for guests. They have all the potential to do so.

title: Perfect stay
text: Very friendly staff, perfect location in a calm area but still close to Manhattan with a direct acces by subway of lift. Perfect combination between visiting the city and relaxing. Will come back next time same place when coming to New York

title: Very nice hotel
text:
We were very happy with Graduate Hotel, very good location, very quiet and big room (we had the Graduate Premium Suite). We paid for the upgrade on higher floor, however we stayed on 9th floor and our understanding was that un upgrade for higher floor would be higher than that. However, this didn’t bother us, still very quiet! 
The only down point was the cleanliness of the bathroom, floor had a lot of hair when we just entered in the room. This is the only thing that should be improved.
Staff was very nice and helpful!
Overall, a great experience, we would definitely stay again next time we are in New York!

title: The best and calm place
text:
Atypical hotel, a magical view of Manhattan, and pleasant staff. Only 8 minutes walk from the subway dropping you off in midtown Manhattan; a funicular 5 minutes walk takes you across the east river in minutes. the area is very relaxing and pleasant compared to Manhattan which does not sleep.
if you are like me, who likes to live in calm and a healthy place, who prefers to move around to have fun, this is what you need.
the landscape of this island is just very pleasant, if I could live there, it would be magical every day.

title: Roosevelt island, an exceptional island
text: The site of the hotel is really ideal, magnificent view on Manhattan. Easy access by metro, and the aerial tramway is a great way to get around The decor of the hotel is really reflected on the theme of the island. Very successful. The cleanliness is not optimal for a 4 star hotel, the cleaning in the rooms is not done every day, only on request, which can be complicated. Emptying the garbage and sweeping once a day in a room occupied by 4 people is a minimum. Even at the time of arrival, the room was not quite clean, with dirty floors and dust on the furniture.We slept very well, very quiet, the noises of the city center can be heard from far.

title: Best place ever tried in NYC
text: Roosevelt Island is a fantastic place to see NYC and to stay. The Graduate is... just perfect, arty and very welcome. Families feel comfortable. The restaurant is good and the lobby amazing. And the Panorama is.... wonderful. Nice place and kind people.

title: J Everly
text: Great place to stay. Clean with very friendly staff.  Little bit hard to find parking but the location is excellent.  Park next door is very nice.  Easy to get other parts of the city from this location.

title: Lage ruhig
text:
Frühstück war ein Witz für 15$. Siehe Bild. Lieber ohne bestellen und dann separat bestellen. 
Man kommt nur mit der Seilbahn oder Ubahn nach Manhatten (je 2,75$). 
Zimmerservice auf Anfrage, aber ist ja kein Problem. 
Roof Bar ist top! Es kommen sogar viele junge New Yorker hier her.

title: Nice people and great view
text:
Very Nice hotel, great beds but the bedroom vas a bit small (3 persons and 3 suitcases). Nice people doing their best to make the stay pleasant. the view is amazing!
Very quiet place.
Close to the tram and métro. Liked very much.
1 thing to improve, the price of the bottles in the room 5$ is far to much.
The clearing is not done every Day but it was ok for us especially because the lobby informed us vehen we arrived.

title: Nice but not ready yet
text: Beautiful hotel but not ready for tourist or business man. Rooms not cleaned. It took me 45 min to get a car to Jfk. At 4 am there was no concierge and nobody to help. The room has a beautiful view, best in NYC, but not that clean for what you pay.

title: Excellent compromis pour visiter NY
text:
C'est un parfait compromis pour un séjour agréable à New-York. Situé sur Roosevelt island, face à Manhattan (vue magnifique !), il est au calme, ce qui est très appréciable pour passer de bonnes nuits. Les lits sont d'ailleurs très confortables et la chambre est suffisament grande pour le peu de temps qu'on y passe (nous étions 4 dont 2 adolescentes). Le tramway aérien (à faire !) et le métro sont très proches et vous permettent de rejoindre Central Park en 15 mn ou Times Square en 20 mn. 
La Panorama Room (rooftop) bénéficie d'une vue exceptionnelle. Attention cependant, c'est un bar et donc interdit d'accès aux moins de 21 ans et ouvert seulement les mercredi-jeudi-vendredi-samedi soirs (enfin je crois). Ne pouvant y aller en famille (mes filles n'ont que 16 ans), j'y suis donc allée seule, juste pour faire qques photos. C'est un peu dommage car elles auraient adoré y faire des photos et boire un simple jus de fruit. 
Nous avons aussi apprécié le petit déjeuner, même si le choix est restreint, c'était très bon et suffisant pour nous. Je peux comprendre que ce soit un peu juste pour de gros mangeurs (dans ce cas il faut payer un supplément) mais sincèrement avec l'assortissement de pâtisseries ou le granola maison (délicieux), c'était bien assez !

title: A cozy getaway for families visiting NYC
text: It was our first time taking our five year old to NYC and the Graduate was a perfect hotel to stay at. The staff was very friendly and welcoming and it was an adventure (as in fun, not difficult) to have the option to take the tram or ferry to or from the island. We upgraded to a Junior King Suite and the view was incredible. Just a note to parents of young kids to check the menu of the on-site restaurant before you go (our child is very picky but still had some appetizers, our server was phenomenal) and that kids aren’t allowed in the Panorama room. Thank you for making our stay so cozy and special Graduate!

title: Beautiful views. Serene setting.
text: Yeshaira at the front desk made our stay welcoming. Roosevelt Island is an overlooked gem in NYC. The F train is convenient to get to Midtown quickly. Food on the island was also surprisingly convenient and delightful.

title: Very modern hotel in a very exclusive location in New York
text: Being the only hotel on Roosevelt Island -just 4 minutes by Tramway from Midtown - this Graduate is something very special in a positive sense. The hotel is modern and stylish with a marvellous view onto the skyline of Manhattan over the East River.

title: Amazing views. Spectacular rooms. No housekeeping. Zero management responsiveness. Zero guest services.
text: Amazing views. Excellent location. Many transportation options close by. Quirky modern decor. No hose keeping performed. No housekeeping staff on site. No response after repeated contact. Surprise fees added with no notice for no apparent basic facilities such as housekeeping.

title: Quiet with Amazing Views!!!!
text: This place is amazing! Took the wife for her birthday and wanted something nice yet reasonable. The views alone were amazing! We had floor to ceiling windows on all sides. The sunrise and sunset could be viewed while still in the bed! We wee on the 9th floor. Then we went to the panorama room...even better views! Couldn't have been better! We drove in, and valet was little pricey but u could see your car the whole time whixh we liked. We could get quick access. 30mins drive to evwrything we did. Subwaybwas about 2-3 blocks.

title: Hotel auf der Insel
text: Tolle Lage, leider mit überfordertem Personal. Viele Kleine Probleme, genügend Personal da aber kein guter Service. Als Familie nicht zu Empfehlen. Wenn Sie Wert darauf legen willkommen zu sein, meiden Sie dieses Hotel

title: Nice stay in NY
text: Beautiful hotel, great location for exploring NY, shame about lack of cleaning and bad breakfast right in the hotel, the staff in the restaurant was not organized and the breakfasts were not enough for their price.

title: Excellent Hotel on amazing Roosevelt Island
text: Wonderful stay! Thank you so much for a great experience. The hotel is so lovely, and the customer service is excellent. Even though there is a rooftop bar, the hotel rooms are very quiet. We stayed as a family. Only a couple of subway stops away from Central Park and Times Square area.  Hotel seems like new, and everyone was very friendly.  Roosevelt Island was a gem. Lots of affordable restaurants within safe walking distance of hotel. Four Freedoms Park is beautiful with amazing views of city. We cannot wait to stay here again.

title: 1 semaine à New York
text: Très bel hôtel, excellent emplacement, trop de règles à l’anglo-saxonnes. Nous avions besoin d’une paire de ciseaux pour découper du sparadrap et il a fallu le faire dans la réception car interdiction de prendre les ciseaux dans la chambre. Déjeuner continental, c’est soit café ou jus de fruits. Impossible d’avoir les 2 alors que le café est gratuit dans le lobby! On peut aller se servir dans le lobby, mais sans tasse lavable, il faut prendre un gobelet jetable! Et l’écologie!

title: Un hotel a no perderse! Precioso, limpio, dotado de una vista increíble
text:
Una elección perfecta para pasar una estancia en NYC. A solo dos estaciones del centro, es un hotel muy bien ubicado sin tener que estar en medio del caos de la ciudad. 
Las instalaciones muy modernas y limpias, el personal muy amable y la vista estupenda

title: Simplement parfait!
text:
Un hotel con instalaciones modernas y agradables, limpio, dotado de vistas excepcionales y muy bien ubicado. El metro está cerca y en dos estaciones estás en pleno centro de NYC. La mejor elección que pudimos elegir.
No recomiendo quedarse en pleno centro caótico de NYC. Les recomiendo de este lugar mucho más bonito y limpio

title: Very good hotel for NY
text:
With its location and view, this hotel was very good for us. We just had 15 minutes to reach Times Square and we were able to enjoy the view every time. 
Every employee was very professional : caring and kind.

title: Great views lacking service
text:
The views from the hotel are spectacular and access to Manhattan is pretty easy with tram and subway being easily available. Stop by Panorama room in the afternoon- that is truly a must - views, cocktails and small plates are insanely good. 

However overall service at the hotel is clearly lacking, room had nail clippings on the floor, another guest’s restaurant charge was added to my bill and it took days to resolve. Any and every request took forever and 1 person at the front desk simply can’t manage it all

title: Fun, NYC getaway on Roosevelt island
text: We stayed at the Grauate for 2 nights as a family of 4 in a double double. We had ample room and magnificent views over Manhattan. A fun, hotel with great food, bar and service. Right next to the tram - the experience of travelling across the river really made our stay.

title: Very clean, good area, close to underground
text: Very clean, good area, close to underground. I think it is safety area and wonderful view when you come out of hotel. Bath room was very clean and everything worked very good. Staff was friendly also.

title: Excellent NYC Location
text: Graduate Roosevelt Island is the perfect spot to stay in NYC.  It's a hip hotel in an AWESOME location.  Roosevelt Island offers amazing views of Manhattan without being stuck in the jungle of buildings.  The views from the Panorama Room on the roof are especially superb.  It's quick and easy to get into the city from there via subway or sky tram, and the island itself is quiet and lush. The staff was helpful and the rooms were comfortable with fun & funky decor.  Great toiletries, too.  I'll be back!

title: Fun location, fun hotel, beautiful view of NYC
text: Fun location convenient to multiple transportation options, fun hotel that was impeccably clean, nice staff, and a beautiful view of NYC! Highly recommend if you are traveling with your teen like I was! We enjoyed taking both the ferry and tram on and off the island and the subway was very convenient on days we were in more of a hurry.

title: Tolles Lage in New York
text: Hotel ist sehr zu empfehlen, ist gut mit U-Bahn, Fähre, Bus oder Gondel erreichbar. Im Sommer kühlt der Wind die Insel etwas ab, man kann sogar draussen essen oder spazieren gehen. Tolle Restaurants in der näheren Umgebung (Granny Annies oder Under the Bridge).

title: Un oasis de tranquilidad en Manhattan
text: Hermoso hotel, con vistas alucinantes en un tranquilo barrio, pero cercano a todas las atracciones que debes ver en New York, muy buena comida, con estación de subway a 3 minutos, con el Tram a 2 minutos, muy bueno para ir en familia, con staff super ameno.

title: Great Hotel, quiet location, amazing views!!
text: We stayed in a Premium Junior Suite, and the views were amazing!! The bed, linens, and sofa were very comfortable. The hotel room was so quiet that I needed to put white noise on to sleep. The subway, bus, ferry, and aerial tram were all within a short walking distance, and we were able to explore Manhattan, Brooklyn, and Queens easily. We would absolutely stay here again. We're planning our next trip already!

title: Unusual location but pretty good hotel
text:
I stayed 3 nights in the hotel and was pretty happy with what I got :
- nice room in a very good shape
- nice view on Manhattan (I would not recommend the view on the bridge or on Queens)
- room nicely equipped.

I would report a few surprising points :
- breakfast starts at 8 am on weekdays, an impractical proposition for me
- there a gap of about one inch between room doors and the floor, which keeps you fully aware of anything happening in the hall
- the desk in my room had no decent lighting. There was however a sort of desk light screwed to the wall about 5 feet away that was essentially useless
- transportation to/from the hotel can be complicated. It needs careful review before you book
- no cleaning is offered if you stay 3 nights.

title: Security deposit of 400 USD for F&B, still not released after 5 days
text: When checking in the hotel takes 400 USD per room (I booked 3 rooms in total for the family) as a security deposit for food & beverage. At the check-out they said the deposit would be released within 24 hours. After 5 days it is still not released. I called them and they said that something went wrong and they would fix it. Nothing is released so far. For me this is the first time ever to pay such a deposit. Is this normal in NYC? Anyway, they should make sure they release this deposit as promised. Now I have to call them from the Grand Canyon to remind them. Cannot recommend it for this. Location is nice though.

title: Very Disappointing Not for Seniors
text: The Junior Suite was very small, hardly any closet space (as the safe and mini fridge took over half of one side), no coffee/tea in the room. I requested housekeeping 24 hours in advance as they suggested and no one showed up until 3 days later the day before we left in spite of 2 repeated requests.  On day one we were told we needed reservations for breakfast (in a half empty room) so I had to have my 96 year old mum wait around just to get a cup of tea. The choices were unusual and frightfully expensive.
