The Panorama room was nice with a great view but again the food choices were very limited especially if one cannot eat seafood and the prices are very high: a small glass of wine $16, a cocktail drink $18.    I stayed here during the window replacements in my apartment complex as I felt I ought to support a Roosevelt Island business. Never again..  This was my 3rd hotel stay in June 2022 so as a frequent traveler I was really disappointed in the overall lack of comfortable amenities and services. Needless to say the staff were not very helpful.  I regret not using my numerous hotel points and staying in the city.  I had planned to show off to my neighbors who were also thinking of staying there or putting up visiting relatives to Roosevelt Island but now after my uncomfortable stay  I simply cannot recommend this hotel.

title: A stunning hotel
text: This hotel is a hidden treasure. We were lucky enough to get a sublime sunset at the Panama room and had a Devine dinner and drinks. The room was spacious and had amazing wrap around views. My only complaint was that we spent a lot of time commuting downtown and didn’t get to see enough of the Island!

title: Lovely location and best views over the city
text: Well located hotel with easy access to brooklyn and manhattan and fantastic views over nyc skyline. Will stay again but without breakfast as options are limited for the price paid and waiting time for breakfast too long.

title: Not for Families
text:
No daily room service. Must request and they accommodate your request for room service only once every few days. No working phones in room. Impossible to reach front desk for basic amenities & needs. 
No access to rooftop lounge allowed if you have children. 
"Valet" parking $65 daily. Self parking well over $25 a day. 
Not family friendly. Would not stay again.

title: Great location, great price!
text: Queen/Queen room had amazing views of the city and river at an amazing price. Beds were very comfortable. Room nicely appointed, large bathroom with nice shower. Mini fridge but no coffee maker. Make sure you hit the coffee cart downstairs early! Cool decor- combination of Roosevelt and eclectic NY.

title: Very beautiful hotel ideally located but service to improve
text: Very beautiful hotel ideally located, decoration at the top but service to improve, especially room service. Please note that children and teenagers are not allowed, even during the day, in the roof top room.

title: Graduate Roosevel Island - disappointed
text: New hotel on Roosevelt Island, Cornell Tech campus, nice new construction and great location for Roosevelt Island, but recent stay (actually 2 stays in 2 months) was disappointing, especially considering high price. Rooms are small, in adequate drawer space for clothes, very poor communication with front desk (seem understaffed), very poor morning coffee service. Very hard to reach front desk by phone or in person. Lovely patio was NOT being used for dining or snack service due to lack of staffing.

title: It was alright
text: The view was great, but previous hair was left behind in the fabrics of the bed. The amount being charged was also not clarified before hand and we ended up being fully charged a week later which made our account go negative. Other than that, the character of the hotel was charming.

title: Best location/view for the money!
text: We requested a higher floor for the view, but I don’t think the lower flowers lacked a view with the East River and Manhattan just outside the window. The doors are SOLID and you will notice it because this is the absolute quietest hotel room we have ever had! You only hear the outdoors if you open your window (which is cool within itself).

title: Wonderful experience!
text: Our stay at the Graduate was terrific. We decided to step away from the noisy Manhattan, and yet we had easy access to go there through the Tram and go to Long Island city either by bus, the ferry, or by walking on the bridge through pedestrian access. We enjoyed the location around the cutting-edge architecture at Cornell tech campus, The Roosevelt memorial, and beautiful parks.

title: overcharged
text: Hotel overcharged me and kept disputing a lower rate. On top of the security deposit that was not mentioned of being $500 and still had the nerve to not return it. The hotel staff are not trained and must never have worked in customer service. The words "unfortunately" were used constantly and could careless about the customer. Also you cant go between floors because youre limited to your whatever room floor youre staying in. Empty shower bottles in room. Air conditioned worked when it wanted to. out of all the hotels ive stayed in this was by far the overpriced crap ever

title: Amazing location, such a shame they don’t clean your room’
text: Great room with a lovely view, the rooftop bar is the best bar I’ve ever been to in NY in terms of view and atmosphere however really limited on food & you couldn’t get a good beer either, no American beers or any you would recognise. The location is amazing with easy and cheap options to get into Manhattan. The ferry is fab! The real let down for this hotel is that they don’t clean your room, I requested a room clean on 2 occasions and didn’t get one for the entire 4 night stay, no clean sheets and I had to ask for clean towels. The breakfast service is really slow, not the staffs fault they just didn’t have enough of them to cope with the demand.

title: appartment or room?
text:
they don't clean the room even after a long stay. they didn't even after my claim after 2 day however they promise me to do it immediately!
the location is nice 
wonderful panaroma from the bar terrace

title: A perfect stay at The Graduate
text: My partner and I stayed from the 18th until the 23rd of June 2022 at the Graduate Roosevelt Island and we were really pleased with our stay. We were especially suprised with the transport from the Roosevelt Island to the city, by subway, by tram and by ferry it was great! The hotel was also very clean and we had a very nice, big and clean room! The rooftop bar is quite an experience with an amazing skyline view. We will recommend this hotel for couples who are planning the visit NY!

title: Great hotel near the tram
text:
Light, bright, modern, with lots of books in the lobby, this is a fun, kinda charming place. The Roosevelt Island location is a short tram (or subway) ride from 60th Street in Manhattan.
I had a great stay here. Beautiful views, very clean, spacious room (by New York standards.) Outside, you can walk through grassy parks, watch the East River flow by, and see the Manhattan, or Queens skyline.
The Panorama bar at the top has amazing views, and it's kind of loud.
Downstairs, the restaurant is fine, though a bit understaffed when I visited. Insider tip: Try the cafe next door at Cornell Tech. Outdoor dining. Very good coffee was $1.50. Food quite good, too.
Overall, a great hotel experience. Highly recommended...

title: Perfect location when visiting NYC
text: Stayed here when we spent our vacation in NYC. Had everything we needed and easy transportation to get around Roosevelt Island or to get to the  tourist attractions all around. Staff was super friendly and accommodating, rooms were clean and spacious.

title: Wonderful view
text:
Overall the stay was very nice and comfortable, the view out of window in the room is so cool and absolutely fabulous panorama bar is fantastic 

But what I didn’t like is absence of shower gel and shampoos in the individual bottles, those fixed on the wall bottles are so ibis style, and also the bottle of shower gel was almost empty by the way
Mini bar is  empty, that was really strange 
Breakfast is served only starting from 8 AM, I though that it would be nice to start earlier, also, one day it was to crowed and we must wait until we get a table, that was unexpected, so I Almost missed a meeting in the city

I was also surprised that we left a request for room service and it wasn’t done at all

title: Basic hotel
text:
The hotel has nice rooms. The restaurant has a good offer. You have to ask all the time for the cleaning. Towels are not changed sutomatically. 
The cleaning could be better.
They give fresh towels if you ask.
Cleaning the room is an option. They can sometimes forget it, it doesn' t look very organized.

title: Best location
text:
Vistas inmejorables aunque habitaciones muy justas. Personal de recepción no habla español y no eran muy amables, intenté prorrogar mi estancia y como la había hecho con booking me
Remitió a booking sin mucho interés. No hacen las habitaciones por el COVID, cuando allli Nadir lleva mascarilla. Aún así el sitio es genial para pasar unos días en New York sin tener miedo a salir por la noche

title: A NYC gem
text: A beautiful hotel on a beautiful island just minutes from Manhattan. Amazing views, super nice, friendly and professional staff, good food. Didn't like the "continental" breakfast though, it seemed scarce and not worth the price. I loved the lobby, probably one of the coolest lobbies I've seen. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: Wonderful!!
text: Everything was perfect, including the beautiful decor, the wonderful staff and the cleanliness. Highly recommend the hotel. Very comfortable in every sense and very well connected to Manhattan via subway.

title: Great hotel with great views over Manhattan
text:
Great hotel, great location! Quiet area, but Manhattan very easy reachable, by cable cart and/or metro.
Only “downside” were the mugshots in the bathroom which made our 11-year old daughter a bit uncomfortable.
Apart from that, highly recommened!

title: Comfort, clean, cool
text: Cool place with nice staffs, clean and comfortable, nice decor, nice view either room or rooftop bar, around areas is quiet and relaxing , nice experience with the 🚠 nearby, is a gem stone in busy New York City

title: Excellent hotel!!!
text: Love the style of hotel and our queen queen room has really nice view of Manhattan. Nice beds and we really have good night sleep! Hotel is located at excellent location. Very quiet location. Not so far away from Manhatten and very close to Tram/cable car. Enjoy the ride over east River and over looking the Manhatten skyline.

title: Great hotel and amenities
text: We frequently spend weekends on NYC, now we are so happy to find this hotel, on our 3rd time staying in Graduate we just felt like going back home because hotel's crew make you feel like that,  the panorama bar is something that you must try when you stay in

title: Do not book via Priceline
text: We were charged in advance and the hotel advised we were not despite funds being drafted from our account. Check-in was stressful, dining sub par, and guest service was unacceptable.  We will not return.

title: Forever my hotel!
text: This hotel has it all!  It was perfect foe my daughter and I!  The view of our room was worth it, but then you have the best bed in the city!  After a long day, it’s great to think “I can’t wait to get back to that bed!”  The staff was so nice and accommodating.  The restaurant was an experience all In itself.  Getting to the hotel after a long days travel and to be able tosit, eat great food, and relax looking at the view was a wonderful experience.  Everything about this hotel is a 10/10.  I will forever use this hotel when we go to NYC!

title: It’s almost a 4 star but a lot of little things.
text: It’s a clean hotel with good sized rooms that all have a view. It’s quiet and I slept great. But no daily maid service, no coffee in room and staff is for the most part cold and unhelpful even by nyc standards. It’s a descent place just be aware of these constant little things.

title: Hidden Gem
text: First stay at this place and it was just perfect. Short walk from the tram and subway with a beautiful park nearby. The hotel was great and the rooftop panorama room view is fabulous. Definitely make a reservation to enjoy the rooftop to the fullest. We had a lovely room and thought the service was on point. Everyone was friendly, helpful, and accommodating. Perfect place to chill. The promenade is lovely for walking along the river with the fabulous view of Manhattan. Highly recommend!

title: Great view
text: While nothing much happens in this area, the hotel is conveniently located so you can access both Midtown and also Brooklyn quite easily. Parking was easy too.  The view of Manhattan from the Panorama room is breathtaking.

title: Skuffende hotel med fin beliggenhed
text:
Vi havde booket en junior suite til 3 voksne og et barn på 15. Denne indeholdt en dobbelt seng og en opredning. Det var således meningen at vi skulle sove 3 Pers i en seng. Det kan man ikke byde gæster. Også en stor fejl af booking.com

Mens vi boede på hotellet (5 dage) blev værelset ikke gjort rent  og håndklæder ikke skiftet. 

hotellet reklamere med en rooftop bar med udsigt. udsigten var flot men personer under 21 har ikke adgang så halvdelen af vores selskab fik slet ikke se udsigten. 

Restaurant og bar er dyre.

title: Beautiful Place to Stay
text: The Graduate is a refreshing place to stay after a busy day in the city. Transportation is not a problem; it's easily accessible: tram, subway, Uber, etc. The beds are comfortable and the view is breathtaking. The Panoramic Room is a must visit!

title: Beautiful Manhattan view
text: We had a nice stay at the Graduate Hotel. The view from the room on the East River and Manhattan is breathtaking and beautiful. Room was comfortable. The rooftop bar is also nice. However we didn’t appreciate the fact that we had to insist to get the right room we booked as they tried to get us into a room with a view on Queens instead of Manhattan. Same thing for the breakfast : you really have to stand for the menu the vouchers give you right to, otherwise you will get less.

title: Clean and nice hotel
text: Clean and nice hotel, I wish the room size was bigger. Getting $5 for a welcome drink isn't very pleasant. It would be nice to have coffee, tea, or a microwave oven. I will make a reservation again next time.

title: A very cool alternative spot and refuge from the typical Manhattan hoteo.
text: This is a very intriguing alternative hotel - has a boutique feel.  Rooms are large compared to Manhattan hotels.  And the space is designed and fit up very nicely.  I recommend this for out of town visitors - and would stay again when I travel to NYC.  Roosevelt Island is also a nice alternative vibe to Manhattan.  If you like inhabiting the edge - this hotel is perfect.  Allows you to dip in and out of the Manhattan energy as you like.

title: This was a good choice!
text:
I had not been to NY in about 13 yrs. Choosing a hotel to book is always the most stressful thing for me. After searching and researching SEVERAL hotels and reading some very concerning and scary reviews I finally decided to book with the Graduate. No regrets! The property was just like it looks on-line. It was CLEAN. The bathroom was GOOD and big. The water stayed good and hot for all of us every time. The beds were GOOD! The elevator was FAST. Never a wait and they all worked (unlike a lot of review I read about other properties) The subway was super close and the tram was close and amazing. The view was to die for!!!  This was a family of 4 trip for my daughter's birthday week. 
So happy with this location and we will stay here the next time we are in NY.

title: Safety and privacy of hotel guests in jeopardy
text:
Soon after I checked out and left the hotel, I received an invoice from the hotel with a bill that was not mine. After that I communicated with the Operations Manager and reiterated again and again that I had questions over this charge, as I have not spent extras during my stay, however the money was already taken from my bank account directly. Their team then checked and found that the charge was from a meal receipt at their restaurant. I again (the 3rd or 4th time now) told them I never dined at their restaurant - I had to prove this by telling them I was at one of their conference rooms, on another floor, attending a private dinner at the same time and what I wore that night, before they issued a refund (short of $6 probably due to transaction fees ) to me. 

The hotel's handling of guests' privacy is very questionable - it turns out that someone puts my room number on the receipt after having dinner at the restaurant, and I have to bear the cost of the meal. The restaurant staff didn't even double check the name of the room occupant with the diner. I'm glad it wasn't a bill that would deplete my bank account. 

Until now I have received no apology from the team nor the operations manager, nor tell me what actually happened/ how they will improve. In my last communication with them I directly expressed my disappointment as they delivered an impression that I was the troublemaker but then they never replied afterwards.

I really don't want to be hard on people but the service was disappointing and questionable. They really need to rethink about the security/ privacy of guests.

Also there was a stench in my hotel room (I guess due to plumbing issues). 

Not recommended.

title: Anthony Hotel manager very RUDE
text: After charging me $143 for no reason by accident the hotel manager Anthony made it his business to throw snarky remarks at me due to me shaking my head “no” . I was treated differently due to my accent

title: Amazing stay
text: The hotel is worth the money and wait !! Amazing vibe! Friendly staff! Superb service !! & the panorama room was great! Great ambiance and the drinks and food was great as well! I also had breakfast at the restaurant in the lobby!! Great as well! I def recommend this place

title: Great Views, Decent Room, Horrendous Service
text:
I stay here twice a month for a school program, and can confidently say after a career in consulting this is one of the worst run properties Ive ever visited.  Calling the front desk means being on hold for 15min+.  Check in always seems to take twice as long as it should, primarily because they'll often have one person working the computer and two people behind the desk doing nothing.  The only reason I stay here is because my masters program has contracted with the hotel for student lodging, and because of that I get a slightly discounted rate.  Their regular rates plus fees etc is an absolutely ridiculous $400/night as they consider themselves a "luxury" resort, but somehow forget to turn the rooms down 50% of the time.  

If you do get a room, make sure to get back at a decent hour, otherwise you'll be forced to wait for the elevators.  Of the 4 elevators, 1 is reserved exclusively for the use of the rooftop patrons.  1 will inevitably be blocked by the line to get to the roof (which you'll have to push and weave through) and then the last 2 are available to service the 16 floors of paying hotel guests.  

Dont waste your time going to the roof bar after 8pm.  While the views are great, and the bar is actually quite nice, the bartenders are far too busy flirting with girls to actually serve anyone besides said girls.  If you do happen to get some attention and place a drink order, prepare to watch as the bartenders quickly forget to serve you.  I paid $18 for a gin and tonic and watched for 45 min as my bartender took and fulfilled other orders.  On top of that the hotel has perpetually tried making it an exclusive scene and often requires reservations, or forces patrons to wait in line to be let in.  I've literally never seen the rooftop at more than 50% capacity.  The waiting, the exclusivity is all for show, and only to make it seem more appealing than it actually is.  

The rooms are quite decent, and depending on which floor youre on have great views.  However, DO NOT EVER STAY on floors 15 or 16.  They seemingly forgot to insulate the floors during construction and you 100% will hear if not feel the bass from the bars music until 1am.

title: Mixed feelings about this place
text:
Beautiful location but pricy for tapas size portions with not the best service. I sat at one of the tables on the outskirts of the bar for over 20 minutes no one came to give me a menu. He said really ok let me get someone 10 minutes later still no one came over ...I finally got up and ask the guy shucking oysters if he can grab a server for me his response was "I can't I am very busy"..... seriously ridiculous not a great way to treat people .  I finally was able to flag down one of the bartenders to place an order . 

Food and cocktails were very good I order a simple cocktail with cucumber vodka mint and simple syrup because the person next to me ordered one it looked delicious they charged me $21.00 for a small 6oz glass seems a bit much! You can see the breakdown of the bill attached for two people it was over $300 months plus the $45 dollars for parking which they didn't even move or park the car the kept it right where we left it when we drove up to the valet. To park over night the charge 85!!!! This is more then Manhattan prices! the room are beautiful and spacious for NYC standards.

Would I go back ?? probably because it truly is a beautiful location especially during the summer day with amazing views and a great DJ ! 

I Also wish they served a simple burger or sliders on the menu upstairs because the food they have is not very filling .

pros- beautiful new location with amazing views 
Great espresso martini's 

Cons- staff is kinda snotty and dismissive with over the top prices .

Hotel was a max capacity so I do advise booking a reservation in advance because it was fully booked when I arrived I did get lucky two people left and I had a seat by the bar .

title: The Graduate Roosvelt Island Stay
text: Very good hotel, new, good location, nice views. A little disorganised with service, not very organised at the restaurant, bar closes early during the week and one day my room was not cleaned up, but overall positive  experience, I would totally go back.

title: Hôtel fantastique où on se sent comme à la maison et bien plus encore
text:
Mes enfants et moi revenons d'un séjour mémorable dans cet hôtel et sommes partis le coeur bien serrés.
Hôtel est très bien situé, à 2 minutes du téléphérique et environ à 5mn du métro F.
Dès notre arrivée nous avons été tout de suite attiré par la beauté des lieux. 
La chambre est d'une taille convenable pour 4 personnes , les lits sont immenses et très confortables, on y dort très bien.
Et que dire de la vie, cette vue!!!!!!! Elle était magnifique, nous avions tout Manhattan fasse à nous.
Nous étions logés à la chambre 1313 et nous recommandons vivement cet hôtel pour un séjour parfait à New York.
Merci au staff qui est très discret et qui malgré tout se plie en 4 pour répondre à toutes nos attentes.

title: Amazing Experience!
text: Our experience at Graduate hotel in Roosevelt Island was super amazing. We came here for a conference and spent 4 nights. We are from NYC area and we loved it. It is sparkling clean. The decoration is super fun. The staff is very nice. The Panorama Room was a hit. We felt super safe taking the F train or the areal tram to the city. We had a blast. AND the price was very, very competitive with other hotels in the city.

title: Un hôtel très agréable et original
text: Très heureux d’avoir séjourné dans cet hôtel situé sur Roosevelt Island. Très design, confortable et facile d’accès grâce au métro et au téléphérique. La vue de la chambre était incroyable. Quel plaisir !

title: incredible view!
text: We stayed in a suite and the views were astonishing.  We had wraparound windows with views of the bridge and city; really, really beautiful.  The room and lobby design is really clever, nice furniture choices; overall, a great break and one of my favorite hotel stays in the city.

title: The perfect hotel to experience New York
text: What can i say? My first trip to New York was an experience to remember, made all the better with my stay at the Graduate Hotel on Roosevelt Island. The stay was perfect, from booking in to having lunch and drinks in the panoramic rooftop bar and everything in between.  The staff can't wait to assist and always willing to go that extra mile.  The food was incredible and had arguably the best breakfast i've ever had.  Well done Graduate Roosevelt Island. I'll be back.

title: Super convenient oasis
text: I've stayed in several Graduate Hotels previously and this one didn't disappoint in terms of it being a good value with cool decor and a funky and fun vibe. But the Graduate Roosevelt Island was also special because it is the only hotel on RI--which sits between Queens/Brooklyn and Manhattan and is like a quiet, peaceful island oasis. Fun to explore the island, or take the ferry or tram.

title: Great room but they could do a lot better on amenities.
text:
The Graduate is in a fantastic location. The room was comfortable and clean with firm beds, plenty of pillows and fun decor. The decor throughout the hotel is pretty cool. 

It was a big downer, though, to discover no coffee maker in the room. I specifically checked the website for this, and it was listed as available. Nope. To get coffee, you either have to wait till 8 when you can get one complimentary cup of what amounts to warm dishwater from the restaurant, or you have to head out to Starbucks or wherever. Also, the water bottles in the room were $5 each, which is insult to injury when there already is no coffee maker! The body wash dispenser in the shower was empty so I had to call for that. There was no list of numbers to dial to reach hotel services, though the retro phone was very cute -- I tried dialing Zero for the front desk, but was met with silence. I ended up using my mobile to call downstairs. They told me you need to dial Zero, but that clearly didn't work. 

These seem like small things but they add up. The hotel is really nice, cool, hip, and comfortable. It wouldn't take that much to make it a top-notch experience. Especially when it comes to having coffee/tea available in the room. I think hotels are using covid as an excuse to strip small comforts away from guests, the way airlines do. It's too bad.

title: Great for first time to NYC!
text: If it is your first time to NYC, I highly recommend staying here. The view of the city is something you cannot get when you are actually staying in the city. The subway and tram are a 5min or less walk and it only took 15-20 minutes to get to Midtown. Beds are super comfortable and the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Can't wait to go back!

title: Great location and good hotel, let down by a couple of things.
text:
Booked a Queen Queen room for myself and two kids (12 & 15). 

Location:

Basically brilliant. The views were amazing and access via the air tram or F line metro were really easy. 

Room:

Absolutely fine. Shower was a little feeble, but beds were very comfortable. No tea or coffee and bottles of water in the room were $5!

Was there for 4 nights and no maid service unless you asked which was unusual.

Food:

Only had breakfast which was “included”. This was a selling point for me as it meant we could have breakfast and then head out for the day without worrying about immediately having to find something to eat.

But breakfast was a complete shambles. Anyone used to European buffet style breakfast will be disappointed. It was supposed to open at 8 but on our first day it was still not open until around 8:30.

The included breakfast consisted of a bowl of fruit and a pastry with juice or tea/coffee.  First day we got 4 pastries to share between 3 and a bowl of fruit each. The second day this changed to only being able to have one or the other. And it was one pasty each. It also took 40 mins for our bowl of fruit and pastry to come on the second day. 

A lot of people were pretty unimpressed and we didn’t bother for the rest of our trip.

Panorama room bar:

Would like to say this was brilliant but I wouldn’t know. Under 21s weren’t allowed up and the lift didn’t allow you up there with your room key. Although that was not obvious.

One night (Thursday) we came home and dropped the kids off at the room so I could have a look at the bar. Went back down and asked to be allowed up (which required a hotel staff member to activate the lift). I was asked if I had a reservation and said I didn’t but was a guest at the hotel. I was told I wouldn’t be allowed up without a reservation even though I only wanted to go and see the view.  

Some people complained that the higher floors could hear the music late into the night, but to be fair I was on 13, so 5 floors down, which was quiet.

Reception staff:

Very pleasant. I was allowed an extra hour on checkout time which helped and check-in/check-out was perfectly fine.

Overall:

I am glad we chose to stay on Roosevelt Island. It may not be so central but the hotel is really close to both the air tram (cable car) and the metro so access was very easy. Plus it was worth it for the views.

If the hotel sorted out the stupid issues it would be really good. But it did put a dampener on the whole experience, so that was a bit of a disappointment.

title: The VIEW
text: This hotel was a little slice of heaven in the busy borough of Manhattan.  Taking the tram was an experience in itself.  There is a subway stop very close to the hotel so you can be in downtown quickly.  The Panorama Room was an amazing way to experience NYC, day and night!

title: 1 night stay
text: The location is great. A short ferry ride to LIC and Manhattan.  The room was very clean. Check in and out was easy. The only complaint we had is both beds were not very comfortable. We would sink into the middle.

title: Best hotel experience/ views
text: Not only is it unique to stay on Roosevelt island, but this one hotel on the island has amazing views of the city/ bridge. I was in awe and still remember it all fondly. Great staff, great room, comfy bed..i mean waht else can i say

title: The perfect location to experience NYC!
text:
What an amazing hotel!  Graduate Roosevelt Island is a unique and beautiful hotel.  Rooms are spacious and accommodating.  The Panorama Room rooftop bar has unchallenged views of the NYC skyline and the Queensboro bridge.  

Roosevelt Island is a great way to experience NYC.  It is a quiet and quaint island that has some of the most spectacular views we have ever seen!  It is so easy to get to Manhattan with 4 different options.  Over the course of the week we traveled by Subway (F Train!!), Tram, Ferry and Uber.  We used the Citymapper app and were able to get around seamlessly (even on our first trip).

title: Made my Birthday celebration memorable
text: I stayed at the Graduate on Roosevelt Island with my dearest friends to celebrate my birthday. Booking.com did an awful job with my reservation that had be completely panicked but with the help of Omar, Cecilia and the wonderful Alex they assisted with giving me the same rooms at a lower price. When we arrived we were able to get our room (before check-in) and the lovely Yeshara was friendly and offered to help with any thing we may need during our stay. After our outing I returned back to the room to find a handwritten note with a small gift of chocolates & cashews. We continued our night in the Panaroma room which has an amazing view of the city and the Friday night music and scene was great. Overall experience was great. The only feedback would be for the restaurant with the inconsistency in service, coffee served with milk, spoon or refill and no condiments when food was served. I believe they were understaffed. At check-out Allie was also very friendly and professional made the process easy. Thank you for lovely weekend.

title: Great city view!
text:
The hotel has an impressive city view, but the best is the restaurant/bar "Panorama Room".

Excellent vibe, great music, food is good, awesome cocktails. 
Staff is kind of slow for the price that they charge but I belive they have room to improve.

title: Really nice views, employees & experience
text: I stay on Roosevelt Island and booked a room with twin Queen beds for a family event. We were all getting together in NYC. THe check-in was smooth. My family members (kids and adults) raved about the views, the friendly/courteous employees, the nice style touches the the hotel/room and overall stay. If you are looking for drop-dead luxury, look elsewhere. If you are looking for an experience that will stay in your memory banks for a long, long time…go to the Graduate. Respect. 🤛🏽💗

title: Superb Graduate RI
text: Stayed here over St Patrick’s weekend abs it was a delight. Hotel and Rooms were excellent. Best views in NYC for me and RI itself was excellent. Grannie Annie’s Pub, The Pizzeria opposite and the RI Tramway for $3 a pop are all musts on the island.

title: Love the graduate roosevelt island hotel
text: My sister and I stayed the night after planing to go to panorama room. It’s a different vibe, will be coming back soon specially for the summer time to enjoy the view at the rooftop. This was my second time

title: Stay here, it’s far more convenient than you expect.
text: Great space, great price, great size and convenient location. Definitely worth it to stay here. Was initially hesitant based on initial reactions when people heard I was staying on Roosevelt Island, but it was excessively easy to get to everywhere I needed and back and it was nice to have the extra room you def do not get at most other NYC hotels.

title: Birthday at Graduate Roosevelt
text:
I would like to start this review with some shout outs, the following people were pertinent to our trip being as classy and enjoyable as it was: Fenda the restaurant manager,Tivadar our bartender, Johnathan night audit,
Mahmuda host at panorama room,Estelle f&b director and Marina our server.
The front desk team; Yeshaira , Alnethia, Kira (sales) and Shakazia.

This trip was very special to not just myself but my boyfriend who has never been to New York City! We are visiting from Maryland and have never been to another Graduate location besides the one in Annapolis. Our expectations were surpassed with excellence, grace and hospitality at its finest!

From the moment we walked into the room seeing birthday cake and a birthday card to the quality of the bed and the pillows equaled perfection!!
It is very clear to me that the staff has been hand-picked just based on casual interactions. It is nice to come to a hotel where everyone is in sync with one another no matter the department. I certainly cannot wait to return to this location and to visit our newfound friends!!

– Respectfully, Ariel and Patrick

title: Best Overnight Stay in NYC!
text: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Graduate on Roosevelt Island for a quick, overnight stay in NYC. It’s affordable for a quick hit, and from start to finish the management and staff made us feel welcome and like regular guests. There’s not an inch of the hotel that’s not curated, well thought-out, and well attended-to. We stayed in a Junior Suite overlooking the bridge and water which proved to be a stunning daytime and evening view. Had cocktails in the Panorama Room pre- and post- dinner in mid-town: DEFINITELY check this place out around sunset. 11/10 would return and recommend!

title: Graduate Roosevelt Island
text: This hotel was amazing. I stayed here during Valentines Weekend. The staff was very attentive, checking in and checking out was seamless. The room is beautiful and the bed was extremely comfortable. The rooftop bar is an added bonus!

title: Awesome Don’t Hesitate Book This Hotel
text: My experience here was awesome . My boyfriend couldn’t stop talking about it . The staff is extremely friendly & awesome . Rooms are super clean & the views are so beautiful. I’ll be booking again!!!!

title: Roosevelt Island Stay
text: For the price it was worth the stay. View of the view and quick access to get to timesquare  was great. This was my 1st visit to the island. I will definitely will be coming back here for a get away. I recommend this place

title: Newly discovered gem in Manhattan
text: Staying at hotel now and could not be happier. Easy check in, fair, price, and tidy well equipped room. The views from our room are amazing, the staff is friendly and helpful. An oasis in Manhattan. I only wish they had in room coffee. We will come here again.

title: The best vacación
text:
very nice very central and fabulous view 
also very accessible to the train terminal to the tram minutes from the hotel to new york city and manhattan the very good service of all the employees and the food of its first class restaurant the part that is on the roof has a privileged view of the very nice manhatan skyscraper all recommended.

title: Encantador hotel en el corazón de Manhattan
text: Ubicado en la Isla Roosevelt tiene unas vistas al skyline de Manhattan espectaculares. Ambiente muy familiar y seguro, personal muy atento, buenas instalaciones. Me faltó tiempo para visitar el rooftop bar. La decoración muy alegre y detalles como las vistas 3D de algunos objetos del hotel muy curiosos. Excelente relación calidad-precio. Repetiría sin dudarlo. Muy recomendable.

title: Unique Hotel with Excellent Staff!
text:
Unique hotel!! The view of the Roosevelt Bridge coupled with the interior design that incorporated historical relevance was beautiful and well worth experiencing!

I stayed a few months ago and I thought the front desk staff was excellent, especially Charleny and Brent. Charleny assisted me with a room move and I was impressed by her ability to professionally, accurately, and graciously handle the process -- she is an asset to the hospitality industry! I also found Charleny and Brent great to chat with and this contributed to making my stay memorable. 

The property itself has a fun, upbeat design and is in a great location away from the hecticness of Manhattan, yet easily reachable via a short F train ride.

title: The worst hotel experience in the past ten years.
text: The location of the hotel is very good, located on a quiet island in the busy city of New York, but the check-in experience is very bad. I have directly told the hotel manager about the experience, and I also believe that the hotel has the ability to upgrade the customer’s experience.

title: Disappointed
text: In September, I had booked a night for New Year's Eve for myself and my husband to stay one night and go to the Panorama Room for some late night drinks and to ring in the new year. On December 14th, I received an email stating that the Panorama Room would now be holding a $200 per person open bar and live DJ event. This had not been advertised anywhere prior to me receiving the email. I inquired if my husband and I might be able to visit the bar and not participate in the $200pp event, as we had had our reservation since September and this event was newly scheduled, but we were told we could not be accommodated. I chose to cancel the reservation, and the woman I spoke with on the phone when I called to cancel was horrified this event was taking place and she had no knowledge of it until I informed her. I am disappointed in the Graduate Hotel for changing their plans at the last minute and being unwilling to accommodate us.

title: Interesting Location with Great View
text:
We read about the Graduate Hotel on Roosevelt Island and thought that staying on the island with a bit of respite from Manhattan and Queens would be nice. It is a nice location and we enjoyed our stay. The island feels like a little village. There is good access to Queens and Manhattan using the F train to either or the Tram to Manhattan. We found that parking our car was very secure and relatively inexpensive without using a valet. There are multiple places for a breakfast or luch on the island including the hotel.

We had a South facing room on the 16th floor and the view was wonderful but a North facing room or a lower floor would not give you much of a view from the room.

There are downsides to the hotel including needing extra time to get most places in the city. The room was extremely small with almost no closet space or cupboard space. There was no place to keep or work out of your luggage. There was also no hot water or coffee maker in the room (there is a refrigerator). There is also no vent in the bathroom and the heating system is very loud (we turned it off at night and that was fine).

title: Not quite a stellar performer
text: The Graduate gets an A for theming, a B for service, a C for amenities, but a D for logistics. It's positively inane to program room keys to be floor specific. I can understand hotel security and needing a room key to access the elevator BUT making a room key floor specific makes no sense and is a huge inconvenience for your guests. This is especially true when members of the same party party are on different floors. This was a huge turn off along with no microwave, no coffee maker, and no clock in the room. In the school of hospitality, The Graduate has great need for improvement.

title: Stylish, clean, Quiet
text: Great place to stay in NYC.  One subway stop away from upper east but sooooo quiet because it is in the middle of the East River on Roosevelt Island.  This hotel is one of the most stylish in the city at a great price.  Loved it.

title: Lovely stay
text:
My partner and I stayed here 6 nights after Thanksgiving 2021 and had a lovely time. The views & rooms are fantastic, and the location wonderful for it's aerial tramway ride to Manhattan and its proximity to Four Freedoms Park (nice walks, plenty of fresh air fun watching the wild life). Don't miss the view from the Panorama room; there is no better view in the City. The location is great if you want to go quickly via public transport to places like the Park Ave. Armory or the Noguchi Museum. 

All the employees at the hotel were kind and welcoming, but we were SUPER impressed with the front-desk staff member named Allie (sp?), who checked us in. We had booked a larger room, and when we mentioned to Allie that we liked quiet rooms, and that we chose the hotel because we heard the views were incredible, she moved us to a slightly lower floor with a *really* gorgeous view. Thanks so very much, Allie--our stay was made quite special by all that you did for & recommended to us!  :-)

The only down side to staying at this hotel was the restaurant, which seems to be presently hiring (and trying to train) a lot of new staff members. We experienced a good deal of confusion and strange miscommunications regarding menu items, etc,. The restaurant staff did try their best, however, and the manager addressed the small issues kindly & professionally, so we were okay with that.

title: Nice hotel, friendly personnel, horrible service
text:
nice hotel on roosevelt island, very calm for New York, friendly helpful staff
horrible service, probably of lack of staff: no room service, one day no breakfast service
this is very unexpected for a 250$/night hotel

title: Pleasantly Surprised!
text: New York was the best city to meet as our daughter, who goes to Princeton, did not have much time off for Thanksgiving. We flew in from San Diego and our son flew in from Boulder Colorado. Our daughter took the train in. The Graduate Hotel was was easy to get to. Service was excellent, rooms were comfortable and very clean, staff was friendly and professional, location was excellent and very close to subway. Must say we were completely satisfied with our stay!

title: Amazing views
text: Amazing views from the room.  Very clean and good location.  You can take the tramway from the island and in a few minutes you are going to be in Manhattan.  Panorama room has beautiful views.  Excellent service in general.

title: Excellent stay!!
text: Beautiful brand new hotel!  We got 3 room and suites and they all have nice views. Bathroom is clean and water pressure is great that gives you an awesome shower.  Customer service is great and the food at the restaurant is good too.  The elevator requires your room card to access and that makes you feel safe.  Excellent customer service makes you feel so welcomed.  The surrounding books emitted a very scholarly feel.  We will definitely stay there again!!

title: Excellent accommodations
text: Our stay at the Graduate Hotel was very comfortable. We would highly recommend it it anyone visiting NYC.  Roosevelt Island is New York’s best kept secret.  Having a top notch hotel there is icing on the cake. The Anything At All restaurant was excellent and the Panorama rooftop bar was had a great ambiance.

title: Clean, Modern & Stylish New Hotel
text: We were here just for one night, but were so impressed by the decor, the cleanliness and OMG the views of Manahttan! We slept well, but did not have time to enjoy the rooftop restaurant and bar or breakfast the next day, so we'll have to return. This hotel is an easy walk from the RI tramway or the subway F Train, so it's easy to get to from Manhattan.

title: Roosevelt Island
text: As a native New Yorker who now lives in New Jersey, I think Roosevelt Island is a hidden gem. And now with it's very own hotel, it's a fun place to set up base for anyone visiting New York. The hotel has amazing views, inside and out. Super close to the subway and tram hub. Highly recommend.

title: Amazing views and beautiful hotel
text: We booked our room as a one night stay- cation, coming from Brooklyn. Roosevelt Island was a great, quiet, fun place to visit and the Graduate hotel is lovely. Get a top floor request in- spectacular views. This is a repeat trip for our small family, we loved our visit this summer so much here we came back this October!

title: Great hotel, great location!
text: I was very impressed with this hotel. It is quite new, so all of the facilities are in great condition. The decor is fun and just a little funky. The rooms are a good size and very nicely appointed. The restaurant staff were great and the menu short but quite tasty (try the Waygu Burger). The location is perfect if you're visiting the Cornell Tech campus. That said, it is a short subway ride on the F train to the Lex 63 stop. The Panorama Lounge on the 18th floor has incredible views of Manhattan, Queen's, and Brooklyn! The entire visit and the location gave a welcome and unexpected sense of serenity just a few hundred yards away from the exciting chaos of the city. I look forward to my next stay.

title: Great room with fabulous city views
text: We stayed here for 5 days & had a great time. Staff members were friendly, our room was clean & comfortable & we had great views of Manhattan & Queens. The subway (F train) & tram are a short walk from the hotel so it’s very easy to get around. Going back to the hotel feels like a retreat from the city even though you’re in the middle of it.

title: No one cares once they have your money - Buyer Beware
text: Once you book the property and arrive, no one cares about you at all. I tried to check in and was told that they have a computer problem with their check-in system. I was asked to sit and not to worry that someone would come back to me to let me know when the problem would be fixed. I was sitting in front on this person and they never once bothered to come back to check me in and this is after waiting their for 2 hours. When I asked again, I was meanly told why am I so demanding. I was told that if I don't want to wait, I should find another hotel. But they already have my money in advance. I told the rep to refund my charge and then she said that the hotel cannot do this. End result, a 4 hour wait to check-in. When I got into my room at 8PM in which I arrived at 4pm to check in, the room was not made. Their were no towels or toilet paper in the bathroom, the bed was made but no pillows. It seemed as if it was half cleaned. I called for towels, toilet paper, and pillows and they never arrived. I called four times over 2 hours to no avail. I was told that they are short staff and it would be a few more hours. It was now 10PM and I needed to wait a few more hours. I ended up NOT taking a shower, not being able to even clean my hands, and not being able to use the toilet. I slept on a bed with no pillows. I left at 5am. I will never use this hotel again.

title: Dirty rooms and  unhelpful staff with no sense of urgency to furfill guests requests.
text:
Room was dirty, found long hair all over the room, bits of food and dusty table top. Bathroom cabinet panel  was worn down and had cracks it looked as if it would fall out any time posing a danger. They do not have a housekeeping line or numbers for specific areas of the hotel, only one number for information or request 0 but don’t  bother calling them for anything, ie bathroom amenities, towels, tissue paper, coffee, tea, sugar pack as it will never arrive. I had to call them 5 times to remind  them and each time a  person would answer, speaking in a nonchalant manner, does not apologize and told me the same thing that they will inform the person to bring it, amazing part the same person answered twice but she did not recall I had called earlier. The towels I had asked finally arrived but it took more then an hour.  The next  night I had run out off coffee pods, called them and after waiting for 1 hr I gave up and didn’t bother
anymore. Female front desk staff also unfriendly and unhelpful, I asked for some information on a place I wanted to visit, she was inpatient and did not want to help. I think the thing that got to me the most out of everything is that they need to improve on their sense of urgency to fur fill guests request as right now don’t have any. I will never stay here again.

title: Two Nights
text: The view of the river and city was fantastic.  Room and hotel was very clean and comfortable but small.  Price was high when we booked.  Shower was very complex to operate and only warm at hottest setting.

title: Finally a hotel on Roosevelt Island
text: There is a great hotel on Roosevelt Island, It is no longer necessary to tank the F train of tram to go from hotel to the island.  The food in the lobby restaurant is great and the view of the city from the Panorama Room is spectacular.

title: An lovely stay on Roosevelt Island!
text: My NYC based group of friends and I  had an excellent staycation and birthday celebration at the Graduate Hotel on Roosevelt Island! This would be a great alternative to the bustle of Midtown and a short train/car/tram ride to everything you want to explore in the city.  We made reservations at both their bar (Panorama Room) and their restaurant (Anything at All).  Everything we had was delicious, but if you like a negroni and/or a burger, we had some of the best I’ve ever tasted of both at dinner.  And you can’t beat the views from the hotel rooms and especially from the Panorama Room.  We’ll definitely be back again soon!!

title: Hidden Gem
text: Amazing, hip hotel with great staff (for the most part) and ambiance.  The location is great for families as riding the ferry and tram into the city with a toddler is much easier than the subway in the summer.

title: Awesome hotel. Great, quieter alternative to "mainland" Manhattan
text:
While Roosevelt Island is a part of Manhattan it's a smaller island off of "mainland" Manhattan with Queens on the other side. You're a short tram ride away, which is a block from the hotel. You can also take the bus or subway but the tram is best. Plus, you get a killer view of the city as well as the ride being fun for kids and adults alike. I grew up in Queens and went to school at NYU/Brooklyn Law School and I never rode the tram in my life. It was awesome.

The hotel is pretty cool. Very hip, clean, and modern. I'd stay here every time. The rooms are well-kept and well-designed. The beds are comfortable. The views are stellar. There's not much to do around the hotel but I think that's a feature because you get to take a respite from the bustle and craziness of the city. You can just chill and take a walk around the island on the boardwalk and enjoy the views. The rates seem reasonable for NYC and accessible for anyone wanting to stay at a nice hotel while still being pretty close to the action.

The hotel staff is overall pleasant but being a new hotel I think most of the staff are still getting used to the systems and that caused some hiccups upon checking in. Ultimately, our issues were resolved because the Director of Rooms was there and helped resolve our issues but something tells me that it's not sustainable if it's him having to fix everything that is room-related.

Another hiccup that occurred had to do with the elevator bouncer who was primarily checking IDs and vaccine cards for those going to the rooftop restaurant. My family had checked in earlier than me as I parked the car and I didn't know that you needed a keycard to access the elevator. I asked him how come the elevator wasn't responding when I pressed the floor my family was staying and he berated me in front of other guests for not knowing the process and was very rude. I had never experienced such hostility in a hotel/restaurant in my life. Made for a very poor starting experience to our trip and put me in a very bad mood from the start of my family's much-needed vacation. Honestly, if I was his manager and saw that kind of behavior I'd fire him on the spot.

The last hiccup that occurred had to do with the restaurant kitchen staff not showing up for a breakfast one Sunday morning despite our making a reservation the day before. We were never informed that the restaurant was closed for that reason and were made to feel a bit ashamed for not knowing that the kitchen staff was not there. Like, how am I supposed to know the restaurant is closed because no one showed up to cook food? Do I work there? Did anyone tell me? Wait, I'm still the customer, right? Yeah, right.

Anyway, overall, the hotel is great. The restaurant is good when it's open and the staff shows up. Two of the three hiccups have more to do with the restaurant staff and the remaining hiccup will likely get resolved in due time and it ultimately was resolved.  I think as the hotel continues to mature it'll get better with time. The main things you want are already there and I'd look forward to coming back.

title: Great experience, cleanliness and personality
text: I had a very good stay. The hotel has a lot of character, with original decorations, and the room was highly comfortable and clean. The hotel staff was also helpful and friendly, and the check in and out smooth.

title: All style and no substance
text:
The Graduate hotel is similar to fast fashion. You wear it once and you never want to wear it again. The hotel is filled with kitschy instagramable ornaments of poor quality. We stayed on the 17th floor in the presidential suite with a sofa bed in our room. The quality of the sofa bed was terrible. A flimsy mattress bought from a cheap discount store providing you with no rest and a severe backache. No coffee machine or complimentary water in the room. No microwave, no dishes and no ice in the fridge or ice tray available. No thought was given to the comfort of the guests. 

The bathroom was clean and the towels were plush. Unfortunately the water pressure in the shower was horrid. 

For a hotel with over 200 rooms they had only 1 ice machine on the fifth floor. This machine never worked and was unable to dispense any ice. We approached the front desk about this several times but nothing was ever done. 

The gym had no water bottles or fresh towels. The gym is built in a cramp space with one small window. 

Located on the 18th floor is Panorama, the hotel’s bar. Unfortunately the sound proofing between the 17th & 18th floor is very poor. We felt we were a part of the bar till about 2:30AM at night as we continued to hear music and thumping in our rooms. Sleeping seemed to be out of the question. Around 7:00 AM we awoke to the sound of furniture or other goods being moved around in bar. 

Breakfast was promised to us starting at 8:00 AM. Unfortunately when we approached the lobby restaurant at 8:30 AM the restaurant host told us they did not have staff and breakfast would not be served till 9:30 AM. When we finally sat down for breakfast at 9:30 AM the server had no idea what guests needed to be served. The server kept walking from the restaurant to the lobby to confirm with the front desk. As per the server "The restaurant is independent and the hotel does not do a good job communicating the guests needs". 

For a property that tries to be hip/cool there was no food available past 10:00 PM on a Saturday night. No vending machine and no lobby market. 

My suggestion, step in to take a few photos in the lobby and take in the views of Manhattan from the 18th floor bar. Step straight out afterwards and find yourself a real hotel. The Graduate is nothing more than a flimsy Hollywood set.

title: Covid Getaway
text:
After nearly 2 years of not going on vacation, we ventured out to a close getaway:  a NYC Tram ride from Manhattan to Roosevelt Island’s newest – and only - hotel—the Graduate Roosevelt Island Hotel.  The Hotel is ~200 feet from the Tram.  We were pleasantly greeted by the Receptionist who granted our desires for a upper floor room so that we could see the beautiful night view of Manhattan.  The Hotel has a technology theme going with wall-to-wall books and pictures documenting President Franklin Roosevelt’s impact on Roosevelt Island.  A walk on the streets was most informative on the history of Roosevelt Island and is definitely worthwhile.   

Our room was on the smaller side but well-decorated with the technology theme.  The bedding was most comfortable, especially after a day of walking around sightseeing.  

The first-floor restaurant/bar was a nice delight, after we were informed that the Panorama Bar on the 18th is open only 4 days a week, and the day of our visit, it was closed.  The dinner menu had a nice array of dishes complementing each other, all very reasonably priced.  The Heirloom Tomato Salad, Shells-on-Shells in broth, and Freshly-Made French Fries were flavorsome, as well as the wines.  Our Server, Marilyn—"you know like in Marilyn Monroe"—was energetic, conscientious in doing a good job, and accommodating our requests, like ketchup (inside joke).  Her recommendation of Oatmeal cookies for dessert was spot on.  Marilyn wanting to make our dining experience memorable was, and she definitely was!     

The next day, we rode the Tram back to home and reality—secure in knowing that we could venture out to the Graduate Roosevelt Island Hotel for a quick R&R when we need to.

title: Perfect place
text: The hotel is not only very cool and modern, it is also perfectly placed! A short walk to the gondola that takes you from Roosevelt Island right into Manhattan. Allows a perfect view of the city with inexpensive and easy transportation. Having a restaurant downstairs in a nightclub/bar upstairs with what I would consider the best view of the city!

title: Almost perfect hotel in a perfect location
text: If you are looking for a modern NYC motel in the best location to explore the city without a car, this is the one. The views from the room, and chill Roosevelt Island are utterly amazing! And having three modes of transit—tram, subway or ferry only a short walk from the hotel…make it the place you want to stay for a exportation of New York City. Had the best time staying here!

title: Beautiful getaway to Roosevelt Island!
text: My wife and I decided to stay at the Graduate to celebrate our 10 year anniversary.  We reserved a suite and it was excellent with beautiful views of the city. Travel back and forth to Manhattan was easy using the RI Tramway (4 minute ride, never a long wait, and talk about a fun experience!) The staff at the Graduate were polite, professional, and went above and beyond to make sure our stay was perfect. We can't wait to return!

title: Wonderful Hotel Experience
text: My wife and I live in NYC and decided to do a staycation at the Graduate Roosevelt Island and we’re so impressed by the wonderful rooms, views, staff, as well as the food and drink at both Anything at All and the Panorama Room. It was truly a wonderful experience and we would certainly do it again!

title: Best Hotel Ever
text: From the moment you walk in, the ambience is set. Warm, Hip, and Sexy all in one. The staff is extremely helpful and welcoming. The rooms are speechless, with views of both the lower East side of Manhattan and Long Island City, Queens. Simply stunning! The beds are extremely comfortable and temperature control is controlled by you(which I did not need to adjust). The bathroom was well supplied and water temperature was as well. Overall this hotel is a must to stay if ever in Manhattan and or Queens. Due to being accessible to both locations.

title: So much for a relaxing stay!
text: Air conditioner was busted (even after the tech tried to fix it)- a real inconvenience for us because we're only booked for 1 night!  Housekeeping knocked on our door at 9:30 a.m!  WHO DOES THAT?!? UGH!

title: great hotel
text: Hotel is nicely located for access to Manhattan, very modern and clean. Great for stays involving university business. Tram ride to Manhattan is scenic or subway ride to Manhattan a little faster. Staffis very helpful

title: Graduate Roosevelt Island
text: Great staff, friendly and professional. Great decor and amenities. Definitely would stay there again. Restaurant was good. Rooms were very nice. Great views of the city. Front desk and valet service were very good. Very helpful. Will be coming back.

title: Hidden Gem 💎 at the Queensboro  Bridge 🌉
text: My stay here at Graduate Roosevelt Island was FANTASTIC!!!. This is a hidden gem in Roosevelt Island.,The staff was Great! my room was Incedible right at the Queensboro Bridge over looking the water with boats going by. I have the best view from my room.and the The Rooftop has to be one of the best ever.,The Rooftop was 360 degrees showing 3 different boroughs. ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! there is nothing like it in the world. A must see.. This was such a wonder experience  I recommend to all to stay here, so you can be reminded of how SPECTACULAR! New York is. Lovvvvvvvved everything about my stay here.💯💜💯💜💯💜💯…

title: Stay at the graduate
text: Did not enjoy the check in experience, the room decor is not my style, very high school. The view was beautiful. The check out was equally poor, the staff is not accommodating. The hotel should not charge for a bottle of water in the room. If the hotel wants to be environmentally smart, figure out a way, don't expect a guest to pay $500 and then not get water.

title: Great Place to stay!
text: Great hotel Best View in NYC! Helpful and knowledgeable staff, clean, quiet and very well priced. Loved Roosevelt Island location -  lots to do on the island all walkable or rent citibike. Hotel is an quick ferry or tram ride from anything off Island you want to do. Be sure to reserve Rooftop seating in advance

title: NYC’s best kept secret
text: I would definitely recommend this hotel I took the ferry there so I had the feeling of actually going on a vacation.. the hotel is so beautiful of you’re in art and architecture you wouldn’t be disappointed,hotel staff is so pleasant and welcoming , the island is smack in the middle of everything so like your on this beautiful island in the middle of nyc … definitely would recommend it for family and couples .. great restaurant and not to talk about there rooftop bar with insane views

title: Great rooftop view, restaurant staff a disappointment
text:
Rooftop bar offers a spectacular view, pretty good cocktails, 2021 inflation-included prices at ~$20 a drink. Worth it for the unique view.

Downstairs restaurant is basically the opposite. Rude staff, no seating close to 9pm (despite 9pm being policy) and the opposite of a customer-centric attitude. 

Restaurant experience ruined what otherwise would have been a lovely visit.

title: Great views rom room
text: Very well located on Roosevelt Island. Try and get a room on a higher floor. Great views. Seems like a new hotel.... Loved the Gym. Would help if there as a kettle in the room. Also there was some hair in the bathtub and dustbin when we checked in......

title: disappointed
text: There was not enough lighting in the bathroom to put on makeup... the shower would not drain and I had to stand in dirty water...  The toiletries in the room were good, but they were in large pump bottles (not very secure or sanitary).. No carpet in the room.. rooftop bar people were not all that nice.  The décor and theming is cool

title: Excellant stay
text: Excellent hotel.  The service was exceptional.   I had a junior suite and the view was amazing- the room was designed perfectly  to take it in a terrific view of the Queensborough Bridge. The Panorama Room was  fabulous- possibly the best rooftop bar in NYC. Would definitely recommend.

title: Family Visit
text: My family came to visit us on Roosevelt Island for a long weekend and we booked two rooms at the Graduate Hotel Roosevelt Island.  It’s a brand new beautiful hotel with incredible views of the city.  Unfortunately the rooftop bar and grill wasn’t open yet,  but the pictures make it look incredible.  My family loved the hotel and the staff and can’t wait to come back.  Having lived on Roosevelt Island for years, I know how special and unique it is.  It’s like a small quiet suburb one ferry/tram/or subway stop from Manhattan.  And the hotel is the perfect addition to the island.

title: Island getaway
text: I've been to NYC plenty but never made it to Roosevel Island. Glad I did and the Graduate is a very nice hotel that can give you a getaway feeling while in the middle of the city- RI has a feel of a large town/neighborhood in the city. Cornell campus area quiet,too, on a summer weekend. Great views from our room too of Midtown looking south.

title: Great hotel - what a fantastic hidden Gem!
text: Hotel, staff and amenities were amazing.  The views from the room were breathtaking.  Bedding was so soft and the room was so quiet - I didn't hear 1 horn honk the entire time, as the windows are triple paned.  Great location and close to the Tram and the F Train.  I loved this hotel and will definitely be back again!

title: Family Weekend Getaway/Wedding Party
text:
BIG Thank you for Graduate Roosevelt Hotel's hospitality!  Amazing location for a wedding party.  We used the church in Brooklyn and a venue in Queens.  This hotel was a perfect location for the wedding party for the weekend.  In between the madness we were able to relax and enjoy the views of the city and the East River.

Graduate Roosevelt Hotel's unique brand, design, rooms and amenities represents so much history that you learn so much about the brand and the area of the hotel.  Such a nice concept!  The staff are great, very helpful and responsive.  

My family and I really enjoyed our stay!

title: Fantastic New Hotel
text: I grew up in Manhattan and never set foot on Roosevelt Island until my stay at the Graduate.  The hotel is great.  It is incredibly convenient to Manhattan (one train stop), the build out and furnishings are clean, modern and comfortable, and the view from my room was spectacular - all of this for a fraction of the cost of a stay in Manhattan.  I had an incredible time, the staff was friendly and helpful and I would gladly stay at the Graduate again and again (in fact, I'm staying there again next weekend).  If you are going to spend some time in NYC, this hotel is the best kept secret, and it probably won't be for too long.

title: Relaxing and beautiful, yet perfectly located.
text: Wow. The views of the river and city alone are worth the stay but the room, beautiful lobby, and great service really put this over the top. I was a little tentative staying on Roosevelt Island but the train was incredibly close and the ride to midtown was faster than almost anywhere else I've stayed in NY. As convenient as Manhattan with a more relaxed feel.

title: Best stay in NYC
text: If you are looking to escape the constant buzz of Manhattan, the Graduate is your best bet!  The proximity of the Cornell Tech Center and the beauty of the southern tip of Roosevelt Island make this a hotel a winner.

title: Perfect Staycation
text:
From the initial step into the lobby, to seeing the incredible room, to the hand crafted cocktails and so on this such an incredible experience. My partner and I had a room facing the bridge and were so mesmerized by the view we didn't even use the tv. 

We took a trip down to the bar and were met by Joshua and Diego who made us each custom cocktails based on what we liked (or didn't) I had a "Paper Plane" and he had a spin on a classic "Manhattan". We felt like we make instant friends and took our wagyu burger and sea bass up to the room. 

Taking a night time stroll around Roosevelt Island made us feel like we were really on vacation. Roosevelt Island is a city in it of itself. Quiet and magical at night. 

Spent the rest of the time watching hawks roost atop the 59th street bridge and in the morning were treated to a lil tour an event space in the hotel. No spoiler alerts here- you'll have to see that for yourself- it's Big ; ) Special thanks to Dan for the tour!

We can't wait to come back!

title: Amazing new hotel in the city!
text:
Amazing new hotel in the city. 
As a modern art collector, I was obsessed with the gigantic piece of art from Hebru Brantley, which is holding a light bulb to light up the lobby in their way. 
Clean and spacious room, and there's an option to connect 2 different rooms with door (you must make a reservation for available unit). 
Overall experience was amazing! But the system of hotel should be improved by the time!

title: Graduate from the hustle to a Quiet peaceful comfortable
text: Pleasantly surprised at the convenience of The Graduate on Roosevelt.  Very comfortable beds, amazing views, friendly staff, well appointed bathrooms, relaxing lobby and work places. Safe and quiet  area for morning walks. Easy access to Tram and Subway.

title: Beautiful Views Interesting Location
text: My time at RI was quick, as I was working from the room one day and at the office another. The decor is classic Graduate Hotels with their quirk and eclectic. This decor seemed bare compared to other graduate hotels.    There was also no cups in the room or coffee maker. There was a Starbucks less than five minutes away, but I wish I could use a cup to rinse my mouth after brushing my teeth.  The room was spotless, I think I may have been the first person to ever stay there. The towels were SO plush and thick. The views were amazing. It was tricky to find the outlet behind the desk for my laptop though, but we figured it out!  I would recommend staying here if you don't want to be in the middle of the hustle of NYC, but want easy access to places. The F train comes every 2-5 minutes. There's a beautiful park, bikes to rent, a walgreens/duane reade and a market on the island. There's two restaurants but delievery is cheap. Would recommend a picnic on the lawn! The north side of the island is under construction but you can still walk about 3 miles around the island.

title: Honoring Eleanor and Theodore Roosevelt
text: One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. Room is spacious, beautiful, very modern and artistic in decor while honoring the Roosevelts in photographs. Near transportation. Whole island at your disposal.

title: Buen lugar
text: La experiencia en general muy buena el hotel super lindo y limpio además de su fabulosa ubicación! Lo malo es que publicitan parqueadero que no hay el parking es en la calle y por un valor de 65 dólares creo que deberían se quitar disponibilidad de parquing por que en realidad no la tienen!

title: A secret gem
text:
Excellent, stunning views, unpretentious and welcoming staff with a stellar lobby bar and restaurant. The restaurant is on the fancier side with delicious food but very casual and welcoming vibes.

We loved our room, as a standard king, it overlooked the water and the bridge. Had a desk and great wifi throughout to work/take zoom calls.

title: Gem of NYC
text: Such a charming hotel situated on the south side of Roosevelt Island.  The food, staff, amenities were excellent!  For those who are looking for a quiet place to chill in NYC, while still being close, this is the place.  Also provides excellent views if you get a room facing south.

title: Okay if you’re UES or RI focused
text: Good location for UES things or if you’re on Roosevelt Island for Cornell. Our AC in the room made loud banging noises every time it cycled off and on - otherwise the view was awesome and it is very close to the F train and Tram. Don’t expect any taxis (or help calling them) - it’s public transport or Uber from here!

title: Loved It!
text: The location is amazing, proximity to the tram, the subway, or the red travel shuttle. Obviously the view is unparalleled. The staff is professional and personable. The grounds are beautiful and the ability to walk across the street and join the walkway along the river is a great perk

title: Top notch hotel with stunning city views
text: We stayed at the new Graduate Hotel on July 4 and scored a room with a spectacular view of the fireworks. We loved everything about our stay - the hotel is extremely well built so sound doesn't carry, the AC works amazingly well. The towels and products are luxurious, as is the bedding. We slept SO well! We also had our dog with us and appreciated the reasonable pet fee and access to lots of green areas to run around in. We can't wait to come back and experience their rooftop snack bar!

title: Fun, comfort and killer views
text: Amazing comfort. Beautiful views of the city. An oasis away from the city less than 4 minutes away from the city. We came for the fireworks and was given an experience that made us feel like the show was just for us.

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text: Our second visit and just as pleasurable a stay. Lobby is absolutely beautiful, rooms are spacious with the best views of Manhattan. Parking- a major issue in town - is plentiful though metered and Island Garage is easily accessible to hotel by free bus shuttle. Easy way to Manhattan is by tram, a very cool experience. Of the many hotels in NYC, this has to be right up there with the best. No doubt we’ll return.

title: Front desk made me cry
text: When I tried to check out I was waved off and told they would charge the credit card on file (which is my credit card since I made the reservation on the Graduate Hotel website and created the account, with my phones number and e-mail address.) I was horrified several days later to find out that the stay was charged on mom's credit card instead of my own. When I called and asked for help from a manager to put it on the correct card, I was not listened to, I was talked over and instead had a defunct policy parroted back to me which I would have LOVED to here when I tried to check out and use my card instead of being waved off. Instead of listening, she yelled at me and hung up, while I was left in tears sobbing and repeating "I need to speak to a manager." I am trying to give the Graduate Hotel money, putting a charge on a new credit card and reversing another charge is not a difficult thing to do. I have worked in hotels and customer service for a decade and have never treated anyone or been treated like this before, I am sobbing and was treated so badly by the the phone receptionist who could care less that this oversight has thrown my family's finances into chaos when all anyone had to do was pass me along to a person with the power to help. I can not stop crying. I have never been this demeaned or dehumanized by a hotel in my life. Sobbing at the powerlessness that could have 100% been avoided if the front desk had not waved me off when I asked to pay. Truly horrified and shaken by this experience.

title: Room is nice Reservation Process is TERRIBLE
text: After booking on hotel website I visited the front desk and had the agent arrange for a room type that met my needs. On check-in another room was offered and only after refusing to pay was a satisfactory room offered.

title: TIM SIZEMORE FAMILY VACATION MACYS 4TH FIREWORKS
text: I want to thank Brent at the front desk for the great experience we had from the start to finish with him personally. He is also a former Ohio person  that gave us the best view of the Macy's fireworks and the most excellent views of downtown Manhattan and the East river. This is one of the nicest Hotels (and plenty of space in the junior suite) in the area as we have stayed in downtown with very small rooms. This Hotel is located on Roosevelt Island with aerial tram access to the subway system. We will be back.

title: A true gem
text: This is as good as it gets. Brand new hotel with an outstanding view of Manhattan. Stylish modern decor. Large rooms by NYC standards. Close walk to subway, ferry and tram. Even parking was very straightforward. The only complaint is that they have bathroom walls decorated with FDR portraits,  so you  kind of feel a lot of pressure while taking care of your private business in there with President closely watching you. :-)

title: Great hotel and staff!
text: Hosted a corporate event here and everything was great from the rooms to staff to food! Roosevelt island is beautiful and it’s very easy to get into the city via the Tram. We also took the ferry to LIC for dinner which was recommended by the hotel which was lovely. The rooftop bar was not open yet but looking forward to returning again for that!

title: All worth the stay!best hotel!
text: Beautiful hotel at the best location in NYC. Accessible to all transport types : Uber/Lyft , buses, trains, ferry and tram!  Rooms are spacious , clean and with happy feeling - excellent view of the city, quiet , and excellent service.

title: Roosevelt Island Gem
text: Amazing views of Manhattan! You cannot beat this location, such a fun little island to stay on and Manhattan is easily accessible by the RI Tram— basically a gondola that glides along the top of the Queensboro bridge and brings you into Manhattan in the most magical way as you soar over the top of buildings and gently land down at 60th And 2nd! Very convenient and super fun! I cannot wait to stay here again. Literally cannot say enough good things about my experience, far exceeded my expectations. The staff is so friendly and helpful, just a real gem of a hotel!

title: Fantastic in every respect
text: Stayed on opening night. Just fantastic. Amazing location, with stunning NY City views, just a few blocks from subway and tram, easy parking. Room on 17th floor had sweeping NY City views, beautifully appointed, quiet. Friendly and helpful staff (fixed AC noise in minutes), tasty food in lobby restaurant. I live in NY City but this was a little getaway. Top notch for everything. Roosevelt park/monument just a few blocks away is a must-see visit.

title: NOW, this is a hotel!
text: Amazing experience! From the minute you walk in, you are greeted with a smile. The room was perfect. The decor is definitely INSPIRING! The atmosphere, the staff catering to me to make sure I had everything was on point. The food was immaculate and delicious!!! Looking forward to returning again!
